subject: Re: Thank You for Your Willingness to Contribute!
snippet: This is a gentle reminder to please complete the email extraction process by 20th June 2025, so we can move forward with cleaning and preparing the dataset for training. As shared earlier, you'll
content:
This is a gentle reminder to please complete the email extraction process
by 20th June 2025, so we can move forward with cleaning and preparing the
dataset for training. As shared earlier, youâ€™ll find the necessary script
and instruction video in the Google Drive folder.

If youâ€™ve already completed the process, kindly ignore this message. If
not, we request you to complete it at your earliest convenience. *Please
donâ€™t hesitate to reach out if you face any difficultiesâ€”we're here to
help!*


On Sun, 15 Jun 2025, 11:45 23DCS056 VANSH MALANI, <23dcs056@charusat.edu.in>
wrote:

>
>
> This is a gentle reminder to please complete the email extraction process
> by 20th June 2025, so we can move forward with cleaning and preparing the
> dataset for training. As shared earlier, youâ€™ll find the necessary script
> and instruction video in the Google Drive folder.
>
> If youâ€™ve already completed the process, kindly ignore this message. If
> not, we request you to complete it at your earliest convenience. Please
> donâ€™t hesitate to reach out if you face any difficultiesâ€”we're here to help!
>
> Thank you once again for being part of this student-led research.
>
> Warm regards,
> Vansh Malani â€“ 23DCS056
> James Dhandhukiya â€“ 23DCS023
> Jugvi Desai â€“ 23DCS021
>
> On Wed, 11 Jun 2025, 15:36 23DCS056 VANSH MALANI, <
> 23dcs056@charusat.edu.in> wrote:
>
>>
>> Dear Atharva
>>
>> Thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project.
>> We truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness
>> of our academic email classification model.
>>
>> As promised, your data will be used strictly for academic purposes, and
>> only informational emails will be processed. Your contribution will also be
>> acknowledged in our final presentation/report.
>>
>> To make the process simple, weâ€™ve prepared a Google Drive folder
>> containing:
>>
>> A script that will extract only academic emails from your inbox.
>>
>> A short instruction video explaining exactly how to run the script safely
>> and securely.
>>
>>
>> https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PbOQD_oKgAsZ9pWPrY62nWme5xyJr6JD?usp=sharing
>>
>> The video is inside the same folder, titled â€œEmail Extraction
>> Instructions.mp4â€.
>>
>>
>> The link to provide the extracted emails is given below
>>
>>
>> https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1NNd3t-VRDvEbDpGLDJOCsyBMA1t19Pdz?usp=sharing
>> Please go through the video before running the script. If you have any
>> doubts or face any issues at any step, feel free to reach out to us â€” we're
>> more than happy to help!
>>
>> Once again, thank you for contributing to this student-led research
>> project. Your support means a lot to us!
>>
>> Warm regards,
>> Vansh Malani â€“ 23DCS056
>> James Dhandhukiya â€“ 23DCS023
>> Jugvi Desai â€“ 23DCS021
>>
>>
>>
>>

subject: Fwd: Emerging Research Trends in Engineering (ERTE 2025)
snippet: Dear Friends, IEEE Gujarat Section, along with Kadi Sarva Vishwavidyalaya and IEEE KSV SB, is organizing a 2-day event â€œEmerging Research Trends in Engineering (ERTE 2025)â€ on July 26â€“27, 2025. The
content:
Dear Friends,

IEEE Gujarat Section, along with Kadi Sarva Vishwavidyalaya and IEEE KSV
SB, is organizing a 2-day event *â€œEmerging Research Trends in Engineering
(ERTE 2025)â€* on *July 26â€“27, 2025*. The theme is *AI for Smart Cities and
Industry 4.0*.

Interested students can find more details in the forwarded mail below.
Regards,
Dhruv Rupapara

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IEEE eNotice <enotice@enotice.ieee.org>
Date: Tue, Jun 3, 2025 at 5:26â€¯PM
Subject: Emerging Research Trends in Engineering (ERTE 2025)
To: <dhruvrupapara@ieee.org>


If you are having trouble reading this message, click here
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=ND6C_G_4XR7QwsC0DN1gvYOvZ57b8ruOGT492fDy5UinE7tL911ili6B-6NrwdnFxyyA1OBe0eeYBZxh9tjRKA~~&t=CNwiJ1nlky-5HZTdButDjA~~>
for the web version.

Dear all,

It is our pleasure to inform you that IEEE Gujarat Section, along with Kadi
Sarva Vishwavidyalaya, Gandhinagar, IEEE KSV SB is organizing a 2-day event
on "*Emerging Research Trends in Engineering (ERTE 2025)*" during *July
26-27, 2025.  *The event aims to provide an insight into industrial
practices, current research areas, and trends in the field of *"AI for
Smart Cities and Industry 4.0."* The event is supported by IEEE SPS, IEEE
CS, IEEE IES/IAS/PELS, and the IEEE PES chapter of the IEEE Gujarat
Section.

*Following are distinguished speakers of the event*

Â·        Mr. Samir Bhatt, E-Infochip, Ahmedabad.

Â·        Mr. Jugal Oza, E-infochip, Ahmedabad

Â·        Dr. Mahipal Jadeja, MNIT, Jaipur

Â·        Dr. Sudeep Tanwar, Nirma University, Ahmedabad

Â·        Mr. Sohil Patel, Oizom Instruments Pvt Ltd, Ahmedabad

Â·        Mr. Naveen Gupta, Deets Digital, Ahmedabad

Â·        Mr. Vicrumnaug Vuppalaty, Fiscal Ox Cloud Pvt Ltd, Vadodara.



*Registration link:*  https://forms.gle/xbNDCXLbJk1zx4Y56
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=-hjM3BbMnc2OcId_rF5ruRICpNteDrR8xlQIK6vV9k7-mvVHi8DpnetQdYkm8Cyfdw6GyuUtVR0aTP5nS0_39g~~&t=CNwiJ1nlky-5HZTdButDjA~~>

Website: https://ieeegujaratsection.org/erte-2025/
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=KqgBIsIwhMGgkP3p3F95_FjCDyeN-Bh5wevi0Lu0H0xsK3f0XlSc4k8WesNQ8i5XxTfKi9CT_hGBPmWZ8F2u6w~~&t=CNwiJ1nlky-5HZTdButDjA~~>

   - *Fees for participation:*
      - IEEE Student Member: Rs. 400/-
      - Non-IEEE Student Member: Rs. 700/-
      - IEEE Professional Member: Rs. 700/-
      - Non-IEEE Professional Member: Rs. 1000/-



   - *Venue:* Kadi Sarva Vishwavidyalaya, LDRP-ITR Campus, Sector 15,
   Gandhinagar.

On behalf of the IEEE Gujarat Section and Kadi Sarva Vishwavidyalaya, we
invite you to attend this event at *Gandhinagar*. Please find attached
herewith the flyer of the event.

Further, you are also requested to share this mail in your network and
among eligible audiences.

Regards

On behalf of Organizing Committee

ERTE 2025

IEEE Gujarat Section

subject: Invitation to Participate in Online Quiz on 11th International Day of Yoga â€“ Organized by NSS-PDPIAS Unit
snippet: Dear All, Warm Greetings! On the occasion of the 11th International Day of Yoga, the NSS Unit of PDPIAS is organising an Online Quiz to spread awareness about the ancient Indian practice of Yoga and
content:
Dear All,

Warm Greetings!

On the occasion of the *11th International Day of Yoga*, the *NSS Unit of
PDPIAS* is organising an *Online Quiz* to spread awareness about the
ancient Indian practice of Yoga and its significance in our daily lives.

We invite all students, faculties, staff and CHARUSAT family members to
participate in this engaging and informative quiz enthusiastically.

*Date:* 17th June 2025
*Mode:* Online
*Quiz Link:* https://forms.gle/Pvc3gGbRbmEGZC6k6
*Time: *10:00 AM to 03:00 PM

*E-certificates* will be provided to all participants on or before June 19,
2025, via email.

The quiz aims to promote the importance of Yoga for physical and mental
well-being and to honour the spirit of this global celebration.

Let us come together and celebrate *Yoga for harmony and peace*.

For any queries, please contact: Dr. Rajesh V. Savalia, M. 94292 22899

-- 
Thanks & Regards,

--

content:
Dear Learner,

Hope your learning journey is going well with SWAYAM Plus!

We are excited to invite you to a *free expert-led masterclass* on *Cloud 
Computing*, designed for aspiring and current IT professionals who want to 
deepen their knowledge and stay ahead in todayâ€™s tech landscape.

Join *Mr. Satish Shettar*, Technical Architect with over 19 years of

snippet: ğŸ“¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members â€“ 2025-26 Dear CHARUSAT Students, We're thrilled to announce that applications for the IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Executive
content:
IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch 2025-26
ğŸ“¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members â€“
2025-26

Dear *CHARUSAT Students*,

Weâ€™re thrilled to announce that applications for the *IEEE CHARUSAT Student
Branch Executive Committee* and its chapter positions are now *open* for
the academic year *2025-26*!

This is your chance to be part of an empowering platform that nurtures
*technical
expertise*, *professional growth*, and *global networking*.
------------------------------
ğŸ” What is IEEE?

IEEE is the worldâ€™s largest technical professional organization dedicated
to advancing technology. Student branches offer a space for innovation,
collaboration, and leadership across engineering domains.
ğŸ’¡ Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?

   - *Enhance Your Resume:* Engage in projects, workshops, and events in
   domains like AI, Robotics, VLSI, Signal Processing, and more.
   - *Global Networking:* Connect with professionals, mentors, and students
   around the world.
   - *Leadership Roles:* Lead initiatives and build real-world leadership
   and teamwork skills.
   - *Exclusive Opportunities:* Participate in events like IEEE Xtreme and
   international conferences.
   - *Access Resources:* Utilize tools like the IEEE Xplore Digital Library
   to stay ahead in your field.

<https://www.ieee.org/membership/students/index.html>

<https://www.ieee.org/membership/index.html>

   1. Main Executive Committee
   2. Computer Science (CS) Society
   3. Women In Engineering (WiE) Affinity Group
   4. Antenna and Propagation Society (APS)

ğŸ“Œ Positions Available

   - Chairperson
   - Vice-Chairperson
   - Secretary
   - Treasurer
   - Web Master

Each position involves managing academic and extracurricular activities,
promoting IEEEâ€™s mission, and encouraging participation within the student
community.

Please fill out the Google Form below and note that the last date is *30th
June, 2025*. The selection process includes evaluation of your responses
and an interview later on.

We look forward to welcoming passionate student leaders into our IEEE
community!

by 20th June 2025, so we can move forward with cleaning and preparing the

and instruction video in the Google Drive folder.

subject: Important Summer Internship Invitation _2024 Batch-Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat) Student [NSDC & SKILL INDIA ACCREDITED CERTIFICATION]
snippet: DEAR STUDENTS OF Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat) PROGRAM UNDER {NATIONAL SKILL DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION} X {SKILL INDIA INITIATIVE} [ JULY ,AUGUST & SEPTEMBER BATCH
content:
DEAR STUDENTS

OF
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat)*
 PROGRAM UNDER

*{NATIONAL SKILL DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION} X {SKILL INDIA INITIATIVE}*
[ JULY ,AUGUST & SEPTEMBER BATCH REGISTRATION]
*Warm Greetings!*
*It is Important for Interested Students to submit their application, if
shortlisted you will receive a response from our HR Team:*

*Submit your Application*
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScgK518jqfIZh_Ho8xE6HknOcDEFKhT3J9oYCtQEEZW6fJZWg/viewform?usp=header>





*Program Overview:*

*First Month: Training*

   - Participate in live lectures and receive guidance from industry
   professionals.
   - You will receive login details after the Registration Process.

*Second Month: Internship*

   - Engage in real-world projects with professional mentorship.
   - *Project Details:*
      - *Individual Assignments:* Complete 10 unique projects with your
      mentor.
      - *Group Capstone Project:* Collaborate in teams on a capstone
      project, with specific roles assigned to each intern. All necessary
      resources will be provided by the company.

*Class Formats:*

   1. *Blended Learning:*
      - Access recorded sessions and join live doubt-clearing sessions
      every weekend.
   2. *Live Mentor-led Classes:*
      - Attend live Zoom sessions 2-3 times per week after 6:30 PM, with
      recorded sessions available for later review. You will also have
access to
      our Learning Management System (LMS) for six months.

*Certificates and Benefits:*

Upon completion, students will receive:

   - A *Certificate of Completion* in alliance with LaunchEd [NSDC]
   - Verified certificates through *Wipro Dice ID*.
   - A *Co-branded Internship Certificate* from leading MNCs.
   - *100% Placement Assistance* and entry to a growing professional
   network.
   - Training on *Low-Code and No-Code Tools*.
   - Curriculum focused on *Generative AI and Prompt Engineering*.
   - Exclusive *Masterclasses* with industry leaders.

subject: Invitation to participate in 11th International Yoga Day - Online Debate Competition organized byÂ IIIMÂ NSSÂ Cell
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings from IIIM NSS Cell!!! To celebrate the 11th International Yoga Day, Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management (IIIM) - NSS Cell has organized an Online Debate competition on
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings from IIIM NSS Cell!!!

To celebrate the *11th International Yoga Day,* Indukaka Ipcowala Institute
of Management (IIIM) - NSS Cell has organized an *Online Debate competition*
 on *June 20, 2025 (Friday).*



*Online Debate Competition â€“ Event Details:*

*Date:* June 20, 2025
*Time:* 10:30 AM Onward
*Theme:* Yoga for One Earth, One Health* (Topics to be provided one hour
prior to the scheduled start of the competition)*

*Registration Process:*
Interested participants are requested to register latest by *June 19,
2025* *till
12 PM* using the following link: https://forms.gle/Qzf1YCSnSnDxqFX68

*Online Debate Format:*
*The structure and flow of the debate will be determined based on the total
number of registered participants. Topics will be shared with participants
one hour prior to the competition.*

*Proposed Rounds:*

   1. *Preliminary Round:*
      - Each participant will speak for 3 minutes, either *for* or
*against* the
      motion.
      - Top-performing speakers from the preliminary round will advance to
      the final round.
   2. *Final Round (Crossfire & Closing Statement):*
      - A crossfire round will be conducted, where the selected
      participants will engage in a Q&A session with each other and the judges.
      - Each finalist will then present a 1-minute closing statement.

*Judging Criteria:*

   - Content & Knowledge
   - Delivery & Clarity
   - Rebuttal & Defence
   - Engagement & Time Adherence

*Certificates:*


   - Winners will be awarded 1st, 2nd, and 3rd prizes.
   - All participants will receive a Certificate of Participation.


Together let's make this International Yoga Day memorable. We look forward
to your cooperation at this extraordinary
International Yoga Day Celebration.



Please contact* IIIM NSS Coordinators: *Dr. Poonam Amrutia (+91 94295
58484); Mr. Brijesh Patel (+91 97370 23027) for further details.


*Kruten Patel*
*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

subject: ğŸŒ¿ Invitation to Participate in Yogya 2025 â€“ University-Level Online Yoga Competition | International Yoga Day Celebration
snippet: Dear Faculty Members and Students, Warm greetings from the CHARUSAT NSS Cell! On the occasion of International Yoga Day 2025, we are delighted to announce â€œYOGYA 2025: The Virtual Yoga Challengeâ€, a
content:
*Dear Faculty Members and Students,*

Warm greetings from the CHARUSAT NSS Cell!

On the occasion of *International Yoga Day 2025*, we are delighted to
announce *â€œYOGYA 2025: The Virtual Yoga Challengeâ€*, a university-level
online yoga competition organized by *NSS ARIP* (Ashok & Rita Patel
Institute of Physiotherapy) under the *CHARUSAT NSS Cell*, in collaboration
with the PHYSICAL EDUCATION & SPORTS SECTION.

This event is an opportunity to showcase your passion for yoga, creativity,
and mindfulness while celebrating the spirit of health and harmony.
[image: âœ¨] Themes for Yogya 2025

   1. Yoga for the Mindful Generation
   2. Breathe In Positivity, Breathe Out Stress
   3. Stretch to Destress
   4. Unity in Diversity â€“ Yoga Beyond Borders
   5. Unplug to Connect: Digital Detox through Yoga

[image: ğŸ§˜] Participation Guidelines

   - Submit a 1â€“2 minute video demonstrating 3â€“5 yoga asanas.
   - Choose any one theme and express it through your flow.
   - Top 10 participants will be invited to perform live in the final round via
   an online platform. (Zoom or Google Meet)
   - Entries will be judged on technique, flow, creativity, and thematic
   expression.

[image: ğŸ“…] Key Dates

   - Last Date for Registration & Submission: 16/06/2025
   - Final Round (Live via online platform): 19/06/2025 (Timings will be
   communicated - preferably evening around  6:00 pm)
   - Result Announcement: 20/06/2025

[image: ğŸ†] Awards & Recognition

   -

   Best Yoga Performer (Student and Faculty)
   -

   Most Creative Flow (Student and Faculty)
   -

   Best Video Setup (Student and Faculty)

[image: ğŸ“œ] E-certificates will be awarded to all participants.


[image: ğŸ“¥] Register & Upload Your Video Here:
https://forms.gle/s7enhcCicAPNZ8N99


For any queries, feel free to contact:

   - Dr. Shreya Swami (PT) â€“ +91-6353651313 - shreyaswami.phy@charusat.ac.in
   - Dr. Disha Shah (PT) â€“ +91-9974790312 â€“ dishashah.phy@charusat.ac.in

We warmly invite all students and faculty members to participate in this
celebration of health, balance, and inner strength. Letâ€™s bend, breathe,
and belong â€” together !!

*Jay Hind !!*
CHARUSAT NSS Cell !!
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*



-- 
Thanks & Regards,

subject: Thank You for Your Willingness to Contribute!
snippet: Dear Atharva Thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project. We truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness of our academic email classification model
content:
Dear Atharva

Thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project. We
truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness of
our academic email classification model.

As promised, your data will be used strictly for academic purposes, and
only informational emails will be processed. Your contribution will also be
acknowledged in our final presentation/report.

To make the process simple, weâ€™ve prepared a Google Drive folder containing:

A script that will extract only academic emails from your inbox.

A short instruction video explaining exactly how to run the script safely
and securely.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PbOQD_oKgAsZ9pWPrY62nWme5xyJr6JD?usp=sharing

The video is inside the same folder, titled â€œEmail Extraction
Instructions.mp4â€.


The link to provide the extracted emails is given below

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1NNd3t-VRDvEbDpGLDJOCsyBMA1t19Pdz?usp=sharing
Please go through the video before running the script. If you have any
doubts or face any issues at any step, feel free to reach out to us â€” we're
more than happy to help!

Once again, thank you for contributing to this student-led research
project. Your support means a lot to us!

Warm regards,
Vansh Malani â€“ 23DCS056
James Dhandhukiya â€“ 23DCS023
Jugvi Desai â€“ 23DCS021

subject: Request for Email Data Contribution â€“ Research Acknowledgment Included
snippet: Dear fellow student, We hope you're doing well. We are a group of students working on a research project focused on analyzing CHARUSAT student inbox data to train a machine learning model that can
content:
Dear fellow student,

We hope you're doing well.

We are a group of students working on a research project focused on
analyzing CHARUSAT student inbox data to train a machine learning model
that can automatically classify academic emails â€” such as faculty
announcements, seminar notifications, class updates, and internship
opportunities.

We are reaching out to a few handpicked students, and we believe your
contribution could significantly strengthen the quality of our dataset. As
a token of appreciation, all contributors will be acknowledged in our final
research presentation/report.

Please rest assured:

Â· Your data will be used strictly for academic and research purposes.

Â· We are only interested in academic/informational emails, not personal
content.

Â· No data will be collected without your clear consent, and we will explain
the data extraction process in detail if you agree to help.

If you're willing to contribute or have any questions, feel free to reach
out. We truly appreciate your support in helping make this student-led
research a success!

Note: Please reach out to us if you agree by 15th June 2025.



Warm regards,

Vansh Malani, 23DCS056

James Dhandhukiya, 23DCS023

Jugvi Desai, 23DCS021

subject: Embrace Harmony: Yoga & Nature Session
snippet: Dear All, As part of the 11th International Day of Yoga (IDY) 2025 celebrations, CHARUSAT enthusiastically invites you to a week-long series of events promoting health, mindfulness, and environmental
content:
Dear All,

As part of the 11th International Day of Yoga (IDY) 2025 celebrations,
CHARUSAT enthusiastically invites you to a week-long series of events
promoting health, mindfulness, and environmental consciousness.

Join us for our special "Yoga & Nature" Session, designed to connect your
well-being with the serenity of the outdoors.

*Event Details:*

   - *What:* "Yoga & Nature" Session
   - *When:* June 16th to June 20th, 2025
   - *Time:* 5:30 PM to 6:45 PM daily
   - *Where:* Centre Lawn, CHARUSAT Campus

This session offers a unique opportunity to experience the profound
benefits of Yoga amidst nature, aligning with this year's IDY theme: "Yoga
for One Earth, One Health." Let's come together to foster holistic
well-being and environmental sustainability.

*Kindly confirm your registration by clicking on:  *
https://forms.gle/qoQfRvsiWWLv1Kmy7

*Who can attend:* All CHARUSAT students, faculty, staff, and the wider
community are welcome!

Please bring: Your own yoga mat and a water bottle.

E-Certificates will be provided to all participants.

Let's celebrate the spirit of Yoga and its connection to our planet. We
look forward to seeing you there!

*For more information, please contact:*
Dr.Pritesh Patel
-- 
Assistant Director of Physical Education and Sports
CHARUSAT Physical Education and Sports Section
(A constituent of CHARUSAT)
*Accredited with "Grade A+" by NAAC, GOI*
*Accredited with Centre of Excellence by GOG*
Landline No: 02697-265036
Mobile : -- 97142 96999

--

Hackathon 2025
To: Professor <atulpatel.mca@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear Professor *

I hope this message finds you well.

I am Dr. Deepti Pillai, formerly with CodeChef and currently serving as
Director â€“ Community at *Shooting Stars Foundation*, a non-profit committed
to advancing access to STEM education and entrepreneurship for underserved
communities.

We are delighted to invite your *girl students* to participate in the
upcoming
*WWT All India Women-Only Hackathon 2025*, organized in partnership with *World
Wide Technology*, a leading US-based IT services company.
Hackathon Highlights:

   -

   *Open to all women college students* (any stream, any year)
   -

   *Theme:* *AI for Financial Inclusion of Women â€“ Economic Empowerment &
   Financial Literacy*
   -

   *Mode:* Online
   -

   *Team Event:* 4â€“6 members (*No team? No problem â€” weâ€™ll help form one!*)
   -

   *Prizes Worth â‚¹3,00,000 (1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th prizes -
   50K/35K/25/15K/10K). A*ll top 25 teams standing a chance to win a
   minimum of â‚¹5,000
   -

   *Hackathon Date:* Sunday, July 13, 2025
   -

   *Last Date to Register: June 30, 2025*
   -

   *Registration Link:* www.starhacks.org/wwthackathon2025
   <https://email.shooting-stars-foundation.org//l/8ohqkV3IvFMrSSAZLmbOXg/1L3mRYYlKvNT1EbrEAqOBw/aznlpRaV3enicF4u4mWwng>

We would be truly grateful if you could share this opportunity with your
students or circulate it through your department WhatsApp/email groups. *A
brochure is attached* for easy sharing.
Institutional Recognition:

The college/university with the *highest number of active women
participants* will receive a *special mention* on our social media and in
exclusive communications to our corporate partners â€” celebrating your
commitment to promoting gender diversity in tech.

Your encouragement could make a life-changing difference for your students,
empowering them to innovate, collaborate, and grow in a real-world setting.

Please feel free to reach out for any queries.



With warm regards
*Dr. Deepti Pillai*
*Shooting Stars Foundation*
*Bengaluru, India*

Give yourself the ability to use AI in many different ways.

ol, li, a { font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif !important;} sup {
font-size: 100% !important; } .nudge-component-icon-column {
padding-left: 12px !important; padding-right: 32px !important; }
.nudge-component-text-column { padding-bottom: 32px !important;

subject: CAREER LAUNCHPAD INTERNSHIP PROGRAM | CHARUSAT
snippet: Dear Student of Charotar University of Science and Technology, We are thrilled to introduce the Career LaunchPad Program, a 3-stage, outcome-focused initiative designed exclusively for students of
content:
Dear Student of *Charotar University of Science and Technology,*

We are thrilled to introduce the *Career LaunchPad Program*, a 3-stage,
outcome-focused initiative designed exclusively for students of *CHARUSAT*.


Please fill out the *Admission Form*:
Admission form <https://forms.gle/DDjMnNEeBnEXV4pPA>
------------------------------
*Stage 1: Learn (Training)*

   -

   *Skill Training:* Master in-demand skills.
   -

   *Mentorship:* Get guidance from experts:
   â–«ï¸ *Ayush Kumar* (Adobe)
   â–«ï¸ *Harsh Vajpayee* (Sony India)
   â–«ï¸ *Aastha Kanupriya* (Capgemini)
   -

   *Masterclass:* Insights from CXOs of Fortune 500 companies.

*Stage 2: Build (Internship)*

   -

   *Live Projects:* Work on 10+ projects, including a Capstone Project.
   -

   *Real Experience:* Solve real-world problems with startups.

*Stage 3: Launch & Create Your Own Product*

   -

   *Founder Sessions:* Learn MVP Building, Pitching & Scaling.
   -

   *Career Tools:* Resume building, mock interviews, and job opportunities.

------------------------------
*Certification & Program Benefits:*

   -

   *Course Completion Certificate* accredited by *NSDC Skill India*
   -

   *Internship Completion Certificate* verified with a unique *Wipro DICE
   ID* â€” trusted by industry leaders
   -

   Enjoy *6 months of Software Access (LMS)* and *Lifetime Access to Growth
   Community*
   -

   Free *Resume Building Sessions* and *Mock Interview Sessions* to boost
   your confidence and skills
   -

   Get practical experience and tools to launch your career successfully

------------------------------
*Ready to launch your career?*

Please fill out the *Admission Form*:
Admission form <https://forms.gle/DDjMnNEeBnEXV4pPA>
------------------------------

*â€œYour career is your launchpad â€” equip yourself with the right skills,
real experience, and the confidence to soar. This program is your first
step to turning dreams into reality.*

subject: Important Instructions for upcoming Practical Exam
snippet: Dear Students, The seating arrangements for the upcoming practical exam are 628A and 615A(2nd floor, CSPIT Civilâ€”Mechanical building). The reporting time for the practical exam is 9:10 AM. You must
content:
Dear Students,

The seating arrangements for the upcoming practical exam are *628A and 615A*
(*2nd floor, CSPIT Civilâ€”Mechanical building*).

The reporting time for the practical exam is *9:10 AM*.

You must bring your lab practical file and assignments with you.

The practical exam will be conducted from *9:10 to 11:30 a.m.*, and you
will not be allowed to leave the lab before *11:30 a.m*.

The viva session will run parallel to the practical exam and may continue
until *4:30 PM*.

*Mobile phones are strictly prohibited* during the exam.

*All the best!*

-- 
Regards*,*
Mikin R. Patel

Assistant Professor cum Research Fellow

IT | Smt. Kundanben Dinsha Patel Department of Information Technology
7600421047
mikinpatel.it@charusat.ac.in
Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT)

<https://www.hubspot.com/email-signature-generator?utm_source=create-signature>

--

subject: Announcement: New IEEE CHARUSAT SB Positions are now open for 2025-26
snippet: ğŸ“¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members â€“ 2025-26 Dear CHARUSAT Students, We're thrilled to announce that applications for the IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Executive
content:
ğŸ“¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members â€“
2025-26

Dear *CHARUSAT Students*,

Weâ€™re thrilled to announce that applications for the *IEEE CHARUSAT Student
Branch Executive Committee* and its chapter positions are now *open* for
the academic year *2025-26*!

This is your chance to be part of an empowering platform that nurtures
*technical
expertise*, *professional growth*, and *global networking*.
------------------------------
ğŸ” What is IEEE?

IEEE is the worldâ€™s largest technical professional organization dedicated
to advancing technology. Student branches offer a space for innovation,
collaboration, and leadership across engineering domains.
ğŸ’¡ Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?

   - *Enhance Your Resume:* Engage in projects, workshops, and events in
   domains like AI, Robotics, VLSI, Signal Processing, and more.
   - *Global Networking:* Connect with professionals, mentors, and students
   around the world.
   - *Leadership Roles:* Lead initiatives and build real-world leadership
   and teamwork skills.
   - *Exclusive Opportunities:* Participate in events like IEEE Xtreme and
   international conferences.
   - *Access Resources:* Utilize tools like the IEEE Xplore Digital Library
   to stay ahead in your field.

ğŸ”— Student Membership Benefits
<https://www.ieee.org/membership/students/index.html>
ğŸ”— General IEEE Membership Benefits
<https://www.ieee.org/membership/index.html>
ğŸ§© Available Committees

   1. Main SB Executive Committee
   2. Computer Science (CS) Society
   3. Women In Engineering (WiE) Affinity Group
   4. Antenna and Propagation Society

ğŸ“Œ Available Positions

   - Chairperson
   - Vice-Chairperson
   - Secretary
   - Treasurer
   - Web Master

Each position involves managing academic and extracurricular activities,
promoting IEEEâ€™s mission, and encouraging participation within the student
community.
ğŸ“ How to Apply

Please fill out the Google Form below. The selection process includes
evaluation of your responses followed by an interview.

ğŸ“‹ Apply Now
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdRjH7KzS5k-HnAYka2T6sf1-Z1Jy9r5lmYifWWcA86FMKLtg/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=102851502240872653276>

We look forward to welcoming passionate student leaders into our IEEE
community!

subject: Advance your career with IIT Madras Semiconductor certifications - Register now
snippet: Dear Learners, We hope your learning journey with SWAYAM Plus is going well. We are excited to share details of two specialized hands-on training programs, designed to enhance your skills in Electrical
content:
Dear Learners,

We hope your learning journey with SWAYAM Plus is going well. We are 
excited to share details of *two specialized hands-on training programs*, 
designed to enhance your skills in Electrical, Electronics, and Mechanical 
engineering.

These training sessions will be *conducted at IIT Madras labs* as part of 
the *SWAYAM Plus *initiative. They offer a unique opportunity for *students 
and alumni* to gain practical knowledge, industry-relevant expertise, and a 
recognized certification to strengthen their career prospects.

Below, youâ€™ll find detailed information about each program, along with 
links to explore further and register.

___________________________________________________________________________

*Benefits of the course*


   - Training will be provided in the state-of-the-art, latest cutting-edge 
   lab at *IIT Madras Centre Electronics Centre (CEC).*
   - Get certified by *IIT Madras and SWAYAM Plus* (a skilling initiative 
   by the Ministry of Education, Government of India)
   - Courses are *NCrF* credit-aligned

*Program Highlights*

   1. *Comprehensive Electronics and Embedded Systems (6 days)*


   1. 
      - Hands-on training in circuit theory, sensors, Arduino 
      microcontrollers, and application-based designs. The training will be held 
      at the Electrical Engineering department's Electronics lab.
      - *Eligibility:* Engineering/Diploma/Science students 
      (Electrical/Electronics) - Current students and alumni
      - *Next batch Schedule: *Starting on June 2nd, 2025, and June 16th, 
      2025 (2 Batches). Please refer to the Registration link below.
      - *Fees:* â‚¹8,000 + GST.
      - Course Link 
      <https://swayam-plus.swayam2.ac.in/courses/course-details?id=P_IITMPR>
       | Register Here <https://iitmpravartak.org.in/CEESRegistration>
   

*2. Advanced Electronic Manufacturing with Power Electronics Fundamentals 
(11 days)*


   3. 
      - Training in PCB soldering, PCB assembly line fabrication, 
      prototyping, and testing. The learners will be working on the complete PCB 
      assembly line in the Central Electronics Centre at IIT Madras. Power 
      electronics fundamentals will also be covered.
      - *Eligibility:* BE/BTech/Diploma 
      (EEE/EIE/ECE/Mechanical/Mechatronics). Current students and alumni.
      - *Next batch Schedule:* Starting on June 2nd, 2025 and June 16th, 
      2025 (2 Batches). Please refer to the Registration link below.
      - *Fees:* â‚¹15,000 + GST.
      - Course Link 
      <https://swayam-plus.swayam2.ac.in/courses/course-details?id=P_IITMPR_02>
       | Register Here <https://iitmpravartak.org.in/AEMRegistration>
   
Happy Learning!

Warm Regards,

SWAYAM Plus Team

--

To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to swayam-plus-announcements+unsubscribe@swayam2.ac.in.

subject: Fwd: Call for Innovative Project Proposals for Funding under iCreate, CSPIT | AY- 2025-26
snippet: Dear Students, The iCreate, CSPIT is inviting Project Proposal for Funding for Innovative Ideas from Students for AY - 2025-26. The iCreate initiative with objectives of Dream, Create and Inspire shall
content:
Dear Students,

The iCreate, CSPIT is inviting Project Proposal for Funding for Innovative
Ideas from Students for AY - 2025-26.
The iCreate initiative with objectives of Dream, Create and Inspire shall
enable fast learners to distinguish themselves through innovative project
development.

For more information please visit https://icreate.charusat.ac.in/

P.S. The deadline for submitting proposal is 15th July, 2025

Important Note: Project Submission must be done by Mentor.

--

subject: Feedback/Nomination on E-Governance (Even Term 2024-25)
snippet: Dear Students, You need to submit the following feedback/nomination in E Governance. 1. Faculty Feedback 2. Institute Feedback 3. Teacher Award Nomination Feedback/nomination is available on E-
content:
Dear Students,
You need to submit the following feedback/nomination in *E Governance.*

*1. *Faculty Feedback
*2. Institute Feedback*
*3. Teacher Award Nomination *

Feedback/nomination is available on E-Governance from *23/05/2025 to
27/05/2025.*

You can use the UG & PG labs (117 and 118) or CHARUSAT app to fill up
feedback. Detail procedure is attached herewith.

You should contact *Mahammadsoaib Saiyad* for any difficulties related to
feedback or login.

Thanks & Regards,
Jignesh Patel & Mahammadsoaib Saiyad
E-Gov Coordinator,
EE Department

--


*Jignesh S. Patel*Assistant Professor
M & V Department of Electrical Engineering,
Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology (CSPIT),
CHARUSAT campus,
Changa
Contact (o): +91 2697 265047

e-mail *

subject: Lost and Found: Ladiesâ€™ Purse Recovered from Classroom 313
snippet: Dear Students, A ladies' purse was found in Classroom 313 and is currently being held at the Motorola Lab - 325. If you believe this purse belongs to you, please visit the lab and provide proper
content:
Dear Students,

A *ladiesâ€™ purse* was found in *Classroom 313*  and is currently being held
at the Motorola Lab - 325.

If you believe this purse belongs to you, please visit the lab and
provide *proper
identification or a clear description* of the purse and its contents to
verify ownership.

We encourage everyone to be mindful of their personal belongings and to
promptly report any lost items.


Thank you

Nirav Vaghela

--

subject: MANDATORY WIPRO SUMMER INTERNSHIP AND AICTE APPROVED INTERNSHIP
snippet: Transform Your Career with Our Exclusive Training & Internship Program! DEAR STUDENT OF CHARUSAT We are excited to announce a unique opportunity in collaboration with NIT Durgapur and Wipro DICE ID
content:
Transform Your Career with Our Exclusive Training & Internship Program!

DEAR STUDENT OF CHARUSAT
We are excited to announce a unique opportunity in collaboration with NIT
Durgapur and Wipro DICE ID, offering a prestigious 2-month Training+
Internship program with certifications from industry giants like CISCO,
META|FACEBOOK, IBM, and various other renowned MNCs in technical and
non-technical domains, with key highlights including placement assistance,
limited seats available, and enhanced career prospects

*Note: If any of your batchmates are missed or haven't received the
notification, recipients are allowed to send this mail to them.*

It is Mandatory for students to submit their application. If you get
shortlisted, you will be getting a call from our HR Team:
*Submit Your Application* <https://forms.gle/k86LWXSJYNX9LQDQ8>
Program Details:Program Overview:

   - *Duration:* 2 months (1 Month of Training + 1 Month of Internship)
   - *Eligibility:* Limited seats availableâ€”ensure you apply early to
   secure your place.

Program Structure:*First Month: Expert Training*

   - Live lectures and mentorship from seasoned industry professionals with
   10+ years of experience.
   - Access to online course materials and recorded sessions.
   - *Learning Focus:* In-depth theoretical and practical knowledge in both
   technical and non-technical domains.

*Second Month: Internship*

   - *Internship Projects:*
      - *Project 1:* 10 individual projects for each intern, designed to
      enhance real-world problem-solving skills.
      - *Project 2:* A collaborative Capstone Project, where groups of 15
      interns will work together under mentor guidance.
   - *Mentorship:* Ongoing live mentorship for projects, offering insights
   and practical experience in solving industry-specific challenges.

Class Formats:

*Blended Program:* Access to recorded classes and live doubt clearing
sessions every weekend.

*Mentor-led/Live Classes:* Live Zoom classes at 6:30 PM for 3 to 4days a
week, with recorded sessions available.

*LMS Portal:* Access for 12 months.
Certification:

After completion of the program, students will receive:

   - *Program completion certificate issued by WIPRO*
   - *Co-branded internship certificate from top MNCs.*
   - *100% placement assistance.*
   - *Access to a thriving professional community.*
   - *WIPRO DICE Certification.*

*Submit Your Application* <https://forms.gle/k86LWXSJYNX9LQDQ8>



*Congratulations to students who have already been selected for our
programs:*

subject: Nomenclature Competition I Multi Utility Building @ CHARUSAT
snippet: Dear Students, CHARUSAT is excited to invite your creative suggestions for naming our Multi-Utility Complex. The facility is a versatile space for CSIC, CIVF, HRDC, COE, IT Cell, IQAC, conference rooms
content:
Dear Students,

CHARUSAT is excited to invite your creative suggestions for *naming our
Multi-Utility Complex.*
The facility is a versatile space for CSIC, CIVF, HRDC, COE, IT Cell, IQAC,
conference rooms, paperless exam halls, an exam control room, and
multitudes of related services. It is designed to cater to the diverse
needs of CHARUSAT's unique initiatives and will play a pivotal role in
enhancing the overall campus experience.


*Criteria for Nomenclature:*

   - Should reflect Vedic/Sanskrit terminologyâ€”easily memorable
   - Should be meaningful and relevant to the facility
   - Should have Clarity, brevity, and creativity
   - Should have a touch of academia or knowledge


ğŸPrize: The best fit name will be awarded a cash prize of â‚¹11,000/- by the
prime donor of this facility, Shri Devang Patel (Nadiad).


Click to fill out the form <https://forms.gle/WDvwYgL4uC2DBHMi9>
*Deadline*: Submit your response before May 30, 2025.


*Kruten Patel*
*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

subject: Revised Guidelines for Skill Augumentation Course â€“ Effective Immediately
snippet: Dear All, As discussed and agreed upon in the meeting with Principal Sir and Dean Sir on 9th May 2025, the following amendments are to be implemented in the Skill Enhancement course for activity point
content:
Dear All,

As discussed and agreed upon in the meeting with *Principal Sir and Dean
Sir on 9th May 2025*, the following amendments are to be implemented
in the *Skill
Enhancement course* for activity point calculation *with immediate effect*:
------------------------------
*1. Category-Wise Minimum Requirement*

Each student must earn a *minimum of 30 points from each category* (Categories
1, 2, and 3) and achieve a *cumulative total of at least 100 points* before
graduation.
------------------------------
*2. Revised Points for MOOC(other than curriculum) on online learning
platform in Category 2:*

   -

   *4â€“8 Weeks / Minimum 30 Hours:* 5 points (revised from 10)
   -

   *More than 8 Weeks / Minimum 50 Hours:* 10 points (revised from 20)

------------------------------
*3. Updated Wording in Category 3:*

The sub-category now reads: *"Representation in Cultural/Sports Activities"*
(*Revised from "only Cultural Activities"* to include *sports
representations* as well.)
------------------------------



*Please find the attached revised Point table information for your
reference and use.*


Thank you for your cooperation.


With Regards,

-- 
Dr. Nilaykumar A. Patel
Associate professor & Head,
Electrical Engineering Dept.
Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT,
Changa. 388421, Ta: Petlad.
Phone:02697 265041

My Web Page: https://sites.google.com/charusat.ac.in/nilaypatel/home

--

subject: IEEE Student Membership Half Yearly Offer
snippet: Dear CHARUSAT Students, We're excited to invite you to join the IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch 2025-26, a platform designed to help you grow both academically and professionally. Whether you're
content:
Dear CHARUSAT Students,

Weâ€™re excited to invite you to join the *IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch
2025-26*, a platform designed to help you grow both academically and
professionally. Whether you're looking to gain hands-on experience, build
your resume, or expand your network, IEEE has something for you!
What is IEEE?

IEEE is the worldâ€™s largest technical professional organization. Our
Student Branches are university-based groups that offer opportunities for
career development, technical learning, leadership experience, and
networking within fields of engineering and related disciplines.
Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?

   - *Build Your Resume with Projects and Skills:* Participate in technical
   projects, workshops, and hackathons in areas like Robotics, Artificial
   Intelligence, Signal Processing, VLSI, and more.
   - *Exclusive Networking Opportunities:* Connect with industry
   professionals, mentors, and peers globally for internships, jobs, and
   guidance.
   - *Leadership Experience:* Take on roles within the branch to develop
   key professional skills.
   - *Access to Global Competitions and Events:* Join competitions like
   IEEE Xtreme and attend conferences that boost your professional exposure.
   - *Resources to Stay Ahead:* Get access to the IEEE Xplore Digital
   Library and other exclusive member tools.

Learn more about the benefits of IEEE membership:

   - Student Membership Benefits
   <https://students.ieee.org/membership-benefits/>
   - General IEEE Membership Benefits
   <https://www.ieee.org/membership/benefits/index.html>

*Avail the half-yearly offer now and join IEEE at a 50% discount!*

Please refer to the attached PDF for step-by-step instructions on how to
take up membership.

For any queries please reply to this mail.

Join IEEE Now <https://students.ieee.org/membership-benefits/>

content:

Your midterm exam marks and continuous evaluation marks have been updated
in the shared sheet. Kindly review your marks and email me at
*nirupatel.maths@charusat.ac.in* if you have any queries regarding them.

subject: Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143
snippet: Thanks for filling out Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143 Here's what was received. Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143 Syllabus: Experiment 2, 3, and 4 Email * 24ee001@charusat.edu.in
content:
Google Forms


Thanks for filling out Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143
Here's what was received.


Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143

Syllabus: Experiment 2, 3, and 4


Email *


24ee001@charusat.edu.in


Name *


Atharva Jayant Chimote


Student ID No. *


24EE001


Institute - Deparmtment *


CSPIT - EE



Untitled Section


Determine the frequency bandwidth of the circuit? *
Captionless Image


31.8 Hz


32.3 Hz


142 Hz


31.8 kHz


In series LCR circuit, Capacitive reactance (XC) = Inductive reactance (XL)  
then circuit ________ *


is capacitive


is inductive


is at resonance


draws minimum current


In RLC series resonance circuit, on resonance the following condition will  
be fulfilled, *


V=VR


I = I(min)


Z=R


VL=VC


In the "Study of Resonance in LCR circuit" experiment, the range of  
frequency oscillator was fixed to ____________. *


20Hz to 200Hz


200Hz to 2KHz


2KHz to 20KHz


20KHz to 200KHz


One resistor of 1000 ohm and a capacitor of 12 pF is connected in series.  
then what is the value of time constant. (pF is picoFarade) *


12 ns (n is nano)


1.2 s


12 fs (f is femto)


none


In series RC ckt, a major part of transient is due to resistor only. *


True


false


The time constant of RC ckt becomes __________ with larger value of  
resistor and capacitor *


Larger


shorter


won't change


None of the aboce


The magnitude of energy stored in a capacitor is given by a formula; E =  
(1/2) (C*V^2) *


True


False


In the "Transient Analysis of RC Ckt" experiment, discharing of capacitor's  
voltage has been measured with respect to ____ *


Current


Time


Resistor


None


Which apparatus is not used in the experiment to measure the variation in  
the magnetic field? *


Battery Eliminator


Coil


Reversible Key


Volt meter


Magnetic fields are produced due to __________ *


Stationary charges


Moving charges


Both a and b


None of the above


One coil of radius of R1 is able to produces the magnetic field of B at the  
center of the coil, if radius of the coil is doubled then what will be the  
value of magnetic field. *


0.5 B


4 B


0.25 B


B


The magnetic field density along the axial line of a circular coil carrying  
current is/does *


Zero


Constant


Vary with distance from the center of the coil


not change


Strength of an electromagnet can be increased by *


increasing the number of turns


increasing the cross-sectional area


increasing current supply


all above methods


Resonant circuits are used in tuning of


A radio


A TV set


Both a and b


CD player

Adversarial misuse of generative AI: Analysis beyond the hype

at 4:00 PM EDT | 1:00 PM PDT

Hi Dr. Priteshkumar,

Amidst the hype surrounding AI-driven cyber threats, what's actually
happening in the wild?

In our upcoming webinar, Adversarial misuse of generative AI: Analysis
beyond the hype
<https://go.cloudplatformonline.com/dc/j-0ZLuKiroz5jBuK2yHK5CJ6ILCpYkKSM2bjwsh0ZRMQWGeonCIIqpEhYE0ycwQp5zliZX7ciSPAjlpccRbKFqvx5lx-Jyj_SUG898ZDn477QCReC6HR4r3n13FDkUkBuVBY1NouHkxwjjD3Z11ExZi4XAg2R5ylNZo1sYxqU0BISMFjoMyNmFbCHqs4pV3KL5G9jKpk9DHcMjxeZbEvB4GZEiKCupnZ64lI0qVNif3NjQuidsj0p5raJ14UR3pQLLi0e0PqYZJjRAvjef8Lm3x-5Qg-T6MitLrLnYBeCWh4HBifAo-rPyA2-Aak5cG7/ODA4LUdKVy0zMTQAAAGaKUvWtr6AASl06eicAURpSlDiyESFNOO01MWKQNcz8ob0uCysvXvBsj0UTstrZr3yVX0jnZI=>,
Google Threat Intelligence experts move beyond theoretical discussions of
abuse of AI, drawing on real-world observations of how government-backed
threat actors have attempted to misuse Googleâ€™s AI-powered assistant Gemini
for cyber attacks and information operations.

Our goal is to shed light on these activities with security professionals
to raise awareness and enable stronger protections for all.

*Topics covered include:*

   - Specific cases of attempted misuse of Gemini by nation-state threat
   actors.
   - How AI is being leveraged across various stages of cyberattacks, from
   initial reconnaissance to post-compromise activities.
   - In-depth analysis of government-backed threat activity and if it
   represents novel or unique AI-enabled attack or abuse techniques.

Speakers

Jamie Collier

Lead Threat Intelligence Advisor (Europe), Google Threat Intelligence Group
[image: Aurora Blum]

Aurora Blum

Threat Intel Analyst, Google Threat Intelligence Group
[image: Bart Inglot]

Bart Inglot

Security Engineer, Google Threat Intelligence Group

Donâ€™t miss this opportunity to stay ahead of the curve in understanding
AI-driven cyber threats.

subject: Join â€œFrench For Allâ€ â€“ 30-Hour Offline French Language Training at CHARUSAT
snippet: Dear Students, Looking to add an exciting and valuable skill to your profile? The Faculty of Humanities (FoH), CHARUSAT is offering a 30-hour offline interactive training program titled â€œFrench For All
content:
Dear Students,

Looking to add an exciting and valuable skill to your profile?

The *Faculty of Humanities (FoH), CHARUSAT* is offering a *30-hour offline
interactive training program* titled *â€œFrench For Allâ€*, from *12th May to
30th May, 2025â€”* specially designed for *beginners and language enthusiasts*
.

In todayâ€™s global job market, just having technical or academic skills is
no longer enough. *Learning a foreign language like French can give you a
competitive edge*, opening up new career opportunities, international
exposure, and cultural insights.

This is your chance to:

âœ”ï¸ â£Explore the beauty and power of the French language
âœ”ï¸ Gain a strong foundation in Listening, Speaking, Reading, and Writing
(LSRW)
âœ”ï¸ Learn in a fun, engaging classroom environment

 *The detailed brochure is attached for your reference.*
ğŸ“ For queries, contact *Dr. Vikas Raval* at +91 94293 56638

Donâ€™t miss this opportunity to enhance your future â€” *enroll now and say
â€œBonjourâ€ to new possibilities!*


Best wishes,
Faculty of Humanities
CHARUSAT


*Kruten Patel*

subject: EEUC101-BEEE - CLASS TEST on 01-05-2025

content:
Dear Students,

As discussed during the lecture on 29-05-2025, a multiple-choice class test
carrying 10 marks is scheduled for Thursday, 01-05-2025 at 09:30 AM in Room
No. 305.

The test will cover Units 5, 6, 7, and 8.

Please ensure you arrive on time.
Prepare thoroughly, and best wishes for your success.

MSM

subject: Journal + Lab Manual Submission, Notification for Quiz 2
snippet: Dear Students, You must certify your lab manual + Journal with the respective lab-in-charge on/before 2nd May 2025. After this date, no journals will be certified, and you will not be allowed to take
content:
Dear Students,

You must certify your lab manual + Journal with the respective
lab-in-charge on/before 2nd May 2025. After this date, no journals will be
certified, and you will not be allowed to take the practical examinations.

Quiz 2 (of 15 Marks) will be arranged on the 3rd of May 2025, which covers
the questions of Experiments 2, 3, and 4. The timing of the quiz will be
4:30 PM to 5:00 PM, the link will be sent 5 minutes before the exam.

Regards
Sanni

--

snippet: Dear Students, Please find the details of the MCQ-based Quiz for MEUC102- Basics of Civil & Mechanical Engineering. Exam type : MCQ-based Quiz Date & day: 01/05/2025, Thursday Platform : Google
content:
Dear Students,

Please find the details of the MCQ-based Quiz for MEUC102- Basics of Civil
& Mechanical Engineering.

Exam type : MCQ-based Quiz

Date & day: 01/05/2025, Thursday

Platform : Google Classroom

Marks : 30 Marks

Time : 8:00 pm - 8:30 pm

Engineering, Introduction to Surveying, Elements of building construction

The exam form will close accepting responses exactly at 8:30 pm. No
requests will be entertained after the stipulated time.

Best Regards,



Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar (M.Tech.| PhD)

subject: EC-Council | Hackerverse Capture the Flag (CTF) challenge - Invites Students for Monthly Cyber-competitions
snippet: Dear students, EC-Council has launched Hackerverse Capture the Flag (CTF) challenge. Find the details below and register using your CHARUSAT email id for the same. Hackerverse is a global cybersecurity
content:
Dear students,

*EC-Council has launched Hackerverse **Capture the Flag (CTF) challenge**.
Find the details below and register using your CHARUSAT email id for the
same.*

Hackerverse is a global cybersecurity competition ecosystem designed by
EC-Council to support and advance the cybersecurity community worldwide.
Rooted in EC-Councilâ€™s longstanding commitment to empowering cybersecurity
professionals worldwide, Hackerverse provides a competitive arena for
individuals across all proficiency levels to demonstrate their skills
through rigorous, gamified *Capture the Flag (CTF) challenges*.

Hackerverse was officially unveiled at Hacker Halted 2022, EC-Councilâ€™s
annual cybersecurity conference that unites ethical hackers, security
professionals, and industry leaders from across the globe. A platform for
thought leadership and technical exchange, Hacker Halted serves as a
convergence point for innovation, research, and discourse on emerging cyber
threats and defense strategies.

Hackerverse has helped EC-Council to broaden its impact, transitioning from
localized cybersecurity competitions to a truly global competitive
platform. *Through Hackerverse CTF, a year-long, free-to-enter Capture the
Flag (CTF) challenge on Hackerverse, cybersecurity professionals and
enthusiasts from around the world can now test their skills on a much
larger stage. *The competition features a dynamic scoring system that
rewards participants for speed and precision, reflecting the high-stakes
nature of cybersecurity. *With over $100,000 in prizes, it represents
EC-Councilâ€™s commitment to supporting and rewarding cybersecurity talent
worldwide.*

As cyber threats continue to evolve, Hackerverse remains a dynamic proving
ground, ensuring that the next generation of cybersecurity professionals is
prepared to meet the challenges of an increasingly complex digital
landscape.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
Subject: EC-Council | Invites Students for Monthly Cybercompetitions
To: priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in <priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in>


*What is the Hackerverse?*

â€œThe Hackerverseâ€ (hacker universe) is an environment consisting of
gamified cybersecurity knowledge and skills-based competitions designed to
support individuals, whether they are aspiring, new, or seasoned
professionals in the cybersecurity field.

[image: A screenshot of a video game AI-generated content may be incorrect.]

*The Hackerverse CTF*

The Hackerverse CTF is a free, global Capture the Flag competition offering
monthly rotating challenges across the latest topics and skills valued by
industry and employers. Participants may compete monthly for cash and
in-kind prizes awarded to players achieving top scores on the leaderboard.

[image: A diagram of a business strategy AI-generated content may be
incorrect.]

*Who Can Register?*

The Hackerverse CTF is open to players ages 14 and up. Any student or
professional who wishes to participate may do so.

[image: A blurry image of a computer AI-generated content may be incorrect.]

*Grow and Validate Your Cybersecurity Skills*

Participants within the Hackerverse CTF will be able to showcase their
skills and talent, completing a series of carefully designed questions that
get progressively more difficult. Players will compete against a global
network for prizes and top rankings. The primary focus of the Hackerverse
CTF is to get more participants engaged in cybersecurity competitions,
leading to increased knowledge and skill development.

<https://hackerverse.com/>

[image: A red background with white text and white text AI-generated
content may be incorrect.]

*Your Cybersecurity Skill Development Starts Now!*

Registration for the Hackerverse CTF is currently open. To find out more
about the Hackerverse cybersecurity competitions and engagements, please
visit www.hackerverse.com.

<https://hackerverse.com/>

snippet: Dear Students, Please find the Second Semester Practical Exam Schedule, May-June 2025 (class & batchwise) in the attachment. Students are instructed to finish their submissions (Termwork) before
content:
Dear Students,

Please find the *Second Semester Practical Exam Schedule, May-June 2025 *(class
& batchwise) in the attachment.

Students are instructed to *finish their submissions (Termwork) before
commencing the practical exam*.

The course coordinators are requested to guide students for the
practical examinations for your course and also requested to provide the
information on practical examination locations, before starting of
practical exams.

You can contact your respective counselor in advance for skill augmentation
submissions.

Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Thank you.

New assignment

Assignment-2
Q.1. Explain the key differences between  and  in Python. When would you  
prefer using a tuple over a list?
Q.2. Why does a set not allow duplicate elements? How does Python enforce  
this behavior?
Q.3. How does a set differ from a frozen set?
Q.4. Between lists, tuples, and sets, which is the most memory-efficient  
for storing large sequences of data? Justify your answer.
Q.5. What are the four pillars of OOP?
Q.6. Explain the difference between a class and an object.
Q.7. What is self in Python?
Q.8. What is method overriding? Give an example.
Q.9. What is the purpose of super()?

<hod.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Head Electrical CHARUSAT <hod.ee@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

Hope this mail finds you well.

CHAMOS Matrusanstha Department of Mechanical Engineering is going to
organize the Poster presentation (MEUC102) for all first-year Mechanical,
Civil and Electrical Engineering students on *19th April, 2025, Saturday*.

Please keep the following points in mind:

   1. The topic will be informed to you by next week. The topic, once
   fixed, will not be changed later.
   2. The weightage will be 10 marks as lab component.
   3. The size of the poster will be *A2 size*. The sample format is
   attached here for your reference. Don't change the size of the poster
   sample. You only need to insert the images and the text related to your
   topic, convert to PDF and take print on A2 size.
   4. Please convey your group (*max 2 in one group*) to your class CR [
   Vishwesh (24ME057) in Mechanical, Dhyey (24CL008) in Civil+ME, Priyansh
   (24EE004) in Electrical]
   5. Any other point, if needed, will be shared with you later.


Thank you.

Best Regards,



Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar (M.Tech.| PhD)

Assistant Professor

Charotar University of Science & Technology

+91 90992 23998 | abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Rucha Limaye <rucha.limaye@dronefederation.in>
Date: Thu, Apr 17, 2025 at 6:47â€¯PM
Subject: Deadlines Extended for NIDAR - India's Largest Student Drone
Innovation Challenge
To: Smit Shah <smit@dronefederation.in>, Team NIDAR (DFI) <
team-nidar@dronefederation.in>


*Registration Deadline Extended for NIDAR!*

Dear *Sir/Madam,*

*We are excited to share that the NIDAR â€“ National Innovation Challenge for
Drone Application & Research*, launched by Drone Federation India in
collaboration with the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
(MeitY), Government of India, *has received an overwhelming response from
students and researchers across the country.*

Launched on 18th March 2025 by Shri S. Krishnan (Secretary, MeitY) and
Prof. T. G. Sitharam (Chairman, AICTE), *NIDAR has sparked immense
enthusiasm among students in higher education institutions and engineering
colleges nationwide.*

In response to multiple requests from the student community, we are happy
to let you know that the *r*egistration* deadline has been extended from
April 18, 2025, to May 10, 2025.*

As we move forward with the competition, utilising this extended timeline, *we
encourage you to inform and motivate your students to participate in
Indiaâ€™s most prominent drone innovation challenge of 2025.*

*For queries, write to* *team-nidar@dronefederation.in
<team-nidar@dronefederation.in>*

*1) **Competition Website:* nidar.org.in
*2) **Official Rulebook:* https://nidar.org.in/rules/
*3) **Prize Details:* https://nidar.org.in/prizes/
*4) Explainer Video:* https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ufUCfgFr4QU
*5) **Launch Video:* https://nidar.org.in/gallery/
*6) **Registration Link:* https://nidar.org.in/register-now/
*7) Promotions with Digital India: *https://bit.ly/nidar-digital-india-video


*Thanks & Regards,*
*Rucha Limaye*
Manager : Community Forums & Events
Drone Federation India (DFI)
New Delhi, India

subject: Fwd:
snippet: JAYANT A. CHIMOTE ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Jayant Chimote <jayantchimote@gmail.com> Date: Thu, 17 Apr, 2025, 7:34 pm Subject: To: <atharvachimote08@gamil.com> Sure!
content:
JAYANT A. CHIMOTE

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Jayant Chimote <jayantchimote@gmail.com>
Date: Thu, 17 Apr, 2025, 7:34â€¯pm
Subject:
To: <atharvachimote08@gamil.com>


Sure! Bevel gears are used to transmit power between intersecting shafts,
typically at a 90-degree angle. Here's a breakdown of how teeth, speed, and
travel interact in bevel gears:
*Teeth*

   - *Tooth Profile*: Bevel gears can have straight, spiral, or hypoid
   teeth. Straight teeth are simpler but noisier at high speeds. Spiral teeth
   provide smoother engagement and higher efficiency [1]
   <https://engineersguidebook.com/bevel-gears-types-and-applications/>.
   - *Pitch Cone*: The imaginary cone that represents the gearâ€™s pitch
   surface [1]
   <https://engineersguidebook.com/bevel-gears-types-and-applications/>.
   - *Tooth Count*: The number of teeth affects the gear ratio, which
   determines the speed and torque conversion [2]
   <https://www.cnclathing.com/guide/gear-types-classification-functions-teeth-profile-nomenclature-calculation>
   .

*Speed*

   - *Gear Ratio*: The ratio of the number of teeth on the driven gear to
   the driving gear. For example, a 20-tooth driving gear meshed with a
   40-tooth driven gear creates a 2:1 gear ratio, resulting in the driven gear
   rotating at half the speed but delivering twice the torque [2]
   <https://www.cnclathing.com/guide/gear-types-classification-functions-teeth-profile-nomenclature-calculation>
   .
   - *Efficiency*: Spiral bevel gears are more efficient at higher speeds
   due to their smoother tooth engagement [1]
   <https://engineersguidebook.com/bevel-gears-types-and-applications/>.

*Travel*

   - *Torque Conversion*: Bevel gears modify torque, trading off speed for
   rotational force. Higher torque is achieved at lower speeds and vice versa
   [2]
   <https://www.cnclathing.com/guide/gear-types-classification-functions-teeth-profile-nomenclature-calculation>
   .
   - *Direction Change*: Bevel gears are designed to change the direction
   of rotation, which is crucial in applications like automotive differentials
   [1] <https://engineersguidebook.com/bevel-gears-types-and-applications/>.

Would you like more detailed information on a specific type of bevel gear
or its applications?

References
[1] Bevel Gears: Types and Applications - engineersguidebook.com
<https://engineersguidebook.com/bevel-gears-types-and-applications/>

subject: Fwd: Invitation to Participate in Indiaâ€™s Largest Hackathon Organised by Odoo India
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in> Date: Wed, Apr 16, 2025 at 9:48 AM Subject: Fwd: Invitation to Participate in India's Largest
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Apr 16, 2025 at 9:48â€¯AM
Subject: Fwd: Invitation to Participate in Indiaâ€™s Largest Hackathon
Organised by Odoo India
To: CSPIT <cspit@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir / Madam,
Greetings!!
Please circulate to the students & encourage them to participate.
Regards,

Trushit

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Shardul Dave <davs@odoo.com>
Date: Tue, Apr 15, 2025 at 4:17â€¯PM
Subject: Invitation to Participate in Indiaâ€™s Largest Hackathon Organised
by Odoo India
To: <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir,

Greetings from Odoo India Headquarters!

We are pleased to inform you that Odoo will be organising one of the
largest hackathons in India - 'Odoo Hackathon 2025' on *11 - 12 August 2025*.
This hackathon is aimed at identifying and nurturing top talent from across
the country with transforming recruitment methods, and we would be honoured
to have your institution participate.

This hackathon presents a valuable opportunity for *final and pre-final
year students* to demonstrate their technical skills and potentially
secure *internship
and job opportunities at Odoo (*subject to eligibility).


*Hackathon Timeline:*

   -

   *06 July 2025 (11:30 PM):* Last date for registration
   -

   *12 July 2025:* First Round (Conducted Virtually)
   -

   *18 July 2025 (7:00 PM):* Announcement of Top 250 Teams
   -

   *11 - 12 August 2025:* Final Round (Offline) at Gandhinagar, Gujarat


For further details and to register, please visit:
https://www.odoo.com/event/odoo-hackathon-2025-7644/register

We kindly request you to circulate the registration link among eligible
students of your institute to ensure maximum participation.

Should you have any questions or require additional information, please do
not hesitate to contact undersigned.

Thank you for your support.

With regards,

*Shardul Dave (M. +91 6357890568) | Assistant Manager (Events)*

Fourth Floor, Tower 3 - Infocity, Gandhinagar, Gujarat - India



-- 
Dr. Trushit Upadhyaya
Professor & I/c Principal
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology
Faculty of Technology & Engineering
Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT)
CHARUSAT Campus, Changa, 388421
Petlad, Anand, Gujarat, India.
M: 7874840344

https://www.charusat.ac.in/cspit/trushitupadhyaya
https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Gzsxo-oAAAAJ&hl=en

subject: Student ID 24ee001, Congratulations on getting Shortlisted for the Internship!
snippet: Dear Student ID 24ee001, Congratulations on getting Shortlisted for the Internship! Launched Global organizing a 2-Month Training + Internship Program with certifications from MNCs in both technical
content:
*Dear Student ID *24ee001*, Congratulations on getting Shortlisted for the
Internship! *

*Launched Global organizing a 2-Month Training + Internship Program with
certifications from MNCs in both technical and non-technical domains. *

 * We are thrilled to announce the Internship and Placement Assistance for
the students, all over India. *

*Students Kindly Go Through All The Information Which Is Mentioned In the
Description Of the  Google Form, **Before Filling the Form:*

*Application Form: *https://forms.gle/4fSnWATch4qMfFsb8
<https://forms.gle/C5UnCQw7uGMQdFk98>

*Certifications/Internships Reports can be submitted to the departments for
the Academic Credit Points.*
*Program Highlights*

*Immer**sive Training Sessions:*

   - Dive into an *exceptional learning experience*, curated by
   professionals from *MAANG companies*, each bringing over *10 years of
   industry expertise*.
   - The program offers *80+ hours of high-quality content*, spread
across *25-30
   dynamic modules*, designed to equip you with cutting-edge skills.

          *  (Login credentials will be provided to the students after
registration)*

* Hands-On Internship under MNCs:*

   - Get deployed directly with one of our partner *MNCs*, where youâ€™ll
   work on *10+ live projects*, solving real-world challenges.
   - Collaborate with industry professionals, gaining valuable practical
   experience and a deeper understanding of your field.
   - *All data, tools, and resources for the projects will be provided by
   the company, ensuring you're set up for success from day one.*

*Post-Program Benefits:*

   - Program completion certificate issued by* Launched Global*
   - Co-branded* Internship Certificate from Top MNCs*
   - Admittance to a *growing community*.
   - *Low-Code and No-Code Tools* training.
   - *100% Outcome-Driven Results*.
   - Curriculum includes *Generative AI and Prompt Engineering*.
   - *Exclusive Masterclasses* with Founders and CXOs of Top Global
   Companies.
   - *Personalized mentorship* for proper guidance.

*We look forward to your active participation in the Training and
Internship Program. This is an excellent chance for you to broaden your
horizons and take a step towards a successful career. For any inquiries or
assistance, feel free to contact us.*

*SHASWATA GUPTA*
*KEY ACCOUNT MANAGER*

subject: INFO!! CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY NOTICE "APPLY FOR IIT COLLABORATED INTERNSHIP"
snippet: Dear Students of Charusat University ( 1st yr ) [ IMPORTANT] Salutations! Launch ED in collaboration with IIT KHARAGPUR KSHITIJ and are organizing a 2 Months Training + Internship program with
content:
*Dear Students of Charusat University*
*( 1st yr )*
*[ IMPORTANT]*



*Salutations!*

*Launch ED *in collaboration with *IIT KHARAGPUR  KSHITIJ *and are
organizing a 2 Months Training + Internship program with certifications
from *CISCO, META* & various other MNCs' s in technical and non-technical
domains. We are enrolling *SHORTLISTED STUDENTS *in the program for
Charusat UNIVERSITY

*Note: If any of your batchmates are missed or haven't received
the notification, recipients are allowed to send this mail to them.*
*LAST 9 SCHOLARSHIP SEAT ARE LEFT*
https://forms.gle/EqAvdBZn1TbB8GJu9

*Students must submit their application. After getting shortlisted, you
will be getting a response from our HR Team:*




*FIND THE BELOW ATTACHMENTS FOR REFERENCE:*
First month: IIT training has been designed in the form of Live lectures
along with live mentorship from industry professionals. (Login credentials
will be provided to students after registration)

Second month: Internship with live mentorship for projects from
professionals. The LIVE INDUSTRY PROJECT will give students experience in
solving real-world problems.

Project 1:- 10 individual projects assigned to each intern which they have
to complete with their mentor.

Project 2:-  Capstone Project: It's a group project assigned to a group of
15 interns. For each intern particular work will be assigned to them they
have to work on it.
(Essential data and materials required for the project will be provided by
the company side itself)

Two types of Classes, we are providing:

1. Blended Program/Recorded classes: You will receive recorded sessions,
whatever doubts you have you can clear it in live doubt-clearing sessions
which will be organized every weekend.

2. Mentor-led/Live classes: You will be having live Zoom classes at 6:30
PM  for 2 to 3 days a week. You will receive your recorded sessions as well
LMS(Learning Management System) portal which you will have admittance to
for 6 months.


*After Completion of the program, the student shall receive a:*
[image: âœ…] *Program completion certificate* issued by IIT KHARAGPUR KSHITIZ.
[image: âœ…] *Certificates verified* through *Wipro* Dice ID.
[image: âœ…] Co-Branded *Internship certificate from Top MNCs.*
[image: âœ…] *100 percent Placement Assistance.*
[image: âœ…] Admittance to a *growing community*.
[image: âœ…] Program Offering with *Low-Code and No-Code Tools. *
[image: âœ…] *100 percent Outcome Driven Result.*
[image: âœ…] The curriculum includes *Generative AI and Prompt Engineering.*
[image: âœ…] *Exclusive Masterclasses* with *Founders and CXOs of Top Global
Companies.*
[image: âœ…] *Personalized Instructors* for proper guidance.




*[THIS NOTIFICATION FOR THE ENROLLMENT OF   MAY-JUNE, JUNE-JULY, JULY-AUG
BATCHES FOR STUDENTS WHO HAVEN'T BEEN ABLE TO ACCEPT THE SCHOLARSHIP SLOT
FOR THE SAME.*

content:
Dear Students,

This is to inform you that the *second online quiz (5 Marks)* is scheduled
on *19th April at 11:00 AM sharp*.

Please note the following *strict instructions*:

   1.

   *No further quiz* will be conducted *either online or offline* under any
   circumstances.
   2.

   Ensure you are in an area with *proper internet connectivity*.

   *Avoid travelling* during the quiz time.

   In case of any *technical error or issue from your side*, the quiz *will
   not be reopened or resubmitted*.

Make sure to take this seriously and be fully prepared in advance.

subject: Fwd: Regarding Poster Presentation for BCME (MEUC102) on 19th April, 2025, Saturday
snippet: Dear Students, Regarding the trailing mail, please find the list of topics allotted group-wise. Follow all the instructions as per the trailing mail and the attached file. The presentations will be on
content:
Dear Students,

Regarding the trailing mail, please find the list of topics allotted
group-wise.
Follow all the instructions as per the trailing mail and the attached file.

The presentations will be on *19 April 2025, Saturday*. So all of you are
requested to plan accordingly.

In case of any queries regarding topic content, please contact your faculty
member.

Thank you.

Best Regards,




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar <abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Mar 27, 2025 at 4:50â€¯PM
Subject: Regarding Poster Presentation for BCME (MEUC102) on 19th April,
2025, Saturday
To: <24me@charusat.edu.in>, <24ee@charusat.edu.in>, <24cl@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Bhavin Mehta <bhavinmehta.me@charusat.ac.in>, Pinal Patel <
pinalpatel.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Bhargav Shobhana <
bhargavshobhana.cv@charusat.ac.in>, GAURANG PATEL <
gaurangpatel.me@charusat.ac.in>, Harmish Bhatt <
harmishbhatt.me@charusat.ac.in>, Megha Desai <meghadesai.cv@charusat.ac.in>,
Dr. Vijay Chaudhary <vijaychaudhary.me@charusat.ac.in>, Head Civil CHARUSAT
<hod.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Head Electrical CHARUSAT <hod.ee@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

Hope this mail finds you well.

CHAMOS Matrusanstha Department of Mechanical Engineering is going to
organize the Poster presentation (MEUC102) for all first-year Mechanical,
Civil and Electrical Engineering students on *19th April, 2025, Saturday*.

Please keep the following points in mind:

   1. The topic will be informed to you by next week. The topic, once
   fixed, will not be changed later.
   2. The weightage will be 10 marks as lab component.
   3. The size of the poster will be *A2 size*. The sample format is
   attached here for your reference. Don't change the size of the poster
   sample. You only need to insert the images and the text related to your
   topic, convert to PDF and take print on A2 size.
   4. Please convey your group (*max 2 in one group*) to your class CR [
   Vishwesh (24ME057) in Mechanical, Dhyey (24CL008) in Civil+ME, Priyansh
   (24EE004) in Electrical]
   5. Any other point, if needed, will be shared with you later.


Thank you.

Best Regards,



Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar (M.Tech.| PhD)

Assistant Professor

Charotar University of Science & Technology

+91 90992 23998 | abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in

content:
Dear Students

Anti-drug Cell invites enthusiastic students to *participate in a* short *30â€“60
second reel-making* competition that conveys a strong anti-drug message.
This initiative aims to creatively spread awareness about the harmful
effects of drug use and inspire students to make positive life choices.

Reel Concept: "Say No to Drugsâ€”Yes to Dreams!"
Duration: *30â€“60 seconds*

Message: *Highlight the harmful effects of drugs and promote a drug-free
lifestyle for a better future.*

subject: Confirmation of Participation â€“ Workshop on "Introduction to PSIM: Basics of Circuit Simulation
snippet: Dear Candidate, We are pleased to confirm your participation in the one-day workshop on "Introduction to PSIM: Basics of Circuit Simulation" organized by The M & V Patel Department of
content:
Dear Candidate,

We are pleased to confirm your participation in the one-day workshop
on *"Introduction
to PSIM: Basics of Circuit Simulation"* organized by *The M & V Patel
Department of Electrical Engineering, CSPIT, CHARUSAT.*
*Workshop Details:*

ğŸ“… *Date:* April 5, 2025 (Saturday)
â° *Time:* 9:45 AM â€“ 4:20 PM (Please arrive by 9:45 AM)
ğŸ“ *Venue:* Lab no. 117 EE Dept, CSPIT
ğŸ’° *Fees:* No fees (Limited to 25 participants â€“ First come, first serve)
*Important Instructions:*

ğŸ”¹ Please bring your *laptop* if you wish to install *PSIM* on your system.
ğŸ”¹ Ensure your laptop is fully charged and capable of running circuit
simulation software.
ğŸ”¹ Be punctual to make the most of this hands-on session.

This workshop will provide *practical insights into PSIM, circuit
simulation techniques, and real-world applications in power electronics and
control systems.*

We look forward to your active participation!

Best Regards,
Dr. Kunal Bhatt

--

subject: Join Us for a Hands-On PSim Workshop on April 05, 2025!
snippet: The M & V Patel Department of Electrical Engineering, CSPIT, CHARUSAT invites you to a one-day workshop on "Introduction to PSIM: Basics of Circuit Simulation." Date: April 5, 2025 (
content:
The *M & V Patel Department of Electrical Engineering, CSPIT, CHARUSAT*
invites you to a *one-day workshop* on *"Introduction to PSIM: Basics of
Circuit Simulation."*

*Date:* April 5, 2025 (Saturday)
*Time:* 9:10 AM â€“ 4:20 PM
*Venue:* EE Dept, CSPIT
*Participation Fees: No fees but keep in mind we have only 25 seats
available.(First come First Serve Basis)*
Workshop Highlights:


   - Introduction to PSIM software and its applications in circuit
   simulation
   - Hands-on training in designing and analyzing electrical circuits
   - Practical demonstrations for power electronics and control systems
   - Ideal for students interested in circuit simulation and power system
   analysis

Donâ€™t miss this opportunity to enhance your circuit simulation skills!

*Register Now! <https://forms.gle/WSoNRavnSxTTXk5x5>*

We look forward to your participation!
[image: Introduction to PSIM Basics of Circuit Simulation.jpg]


--


*Jignesh S. Patel*Assistant Professor
M & V Department of Electrical Engineering,
Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology (CSPIT),
CHARUSAT campus,
Changa
Contact (o): +91 2697 265047

*7* *Switch off as you go* | *q** Always recycle* | *P* *Save a tree..*|
*Please consider your environmental responsibility before printing this
e-mail *

--
