subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025 (NICE-25)-reg.
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in> Date: Sun, 30 Mar, 2025, 5:05 am Subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025 (NICE-25)-
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Sun, 30 Mar, 2025, 5:05â€¯am
Subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025
(NICE-25)-reg.


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/26-Mar/AICTE1/index.html>
------------------------------

Respected Sir/Madam,

Crossword-solving is a powerful cognitive exercise that enhances analytical
thinking, decision-making, memory, concentration, and creativity. It
strengthens problem-solving abilities, fosters a competitive spirit, and
expands vocabularyâ€”skills essential for academic and professional success.

To further promote this engaging and intellectually stimulating activity in
higher education institutions, AICTE, Extra-C, IIM Mumbai, and IIT Madras
have collaborated under an MoU signed on May 21, 2024. As part of this
initiative, the *National Inter-College Crossword Expedition (NICE-25)* is
being organized.

The competition, scheduled between *May and August 2025*, will follow a
hybrid formatâ€”online preliminary rounds leading to offline zonal and
national finals. This event provides students with an opportunity to
sharpen their minds while competing on a national platform.

*Attached are the competition guidelines, format, and tentative schedule. *The
MoU can be accessed on the AICTE website. We invite your esteemed
institution to encourage participation in this unique and enriching
challenge https://nice.crypticsingh.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=19b602f5a3c2a21c88f676f16f1c8a8f3597377f&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
.

*Registrations will begin from 30th March
2025 on  https://nice.crypticsingh.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=19b602f5a3c2a21c88f676f16f1c8a8f3597377f&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
. *

PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/18cFYJTXo0Yq6zmen456z8H28ukWH2QGc/view?usp=sharing
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=176b1da9e198e0df1317262dc16b4adeb16352b9&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>



*With Warm Regards,**Dr. A*
*mit Dutta, *
*Director,*
*Policy & Academic Planning Bureau*
*All India Council for Technical Education,*
*Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj,
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=7ab9fbde99d56338df0c3db2a58401aab648dea5&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>*
*New Delhi- 110070
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=7ab9fbde99d56338df0c3db2a58401aab648dea5&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
*
*Phone no. 011-29581117**Email id - *directorpnap@aicte-india.org

subject: CONGRATULATIONS YOUR PROFILE SHORTLISTED FOR AICTE INTERNSHIP!
snippet: Dear Students, We are excited to inform you that your profile has been shortlisted for an exclusive AICTE-approved Training & Internship Program offered by LearnFlu. This 10-week program provides
content:
Dear Students,

We are excited to inform you that your profile has been shortlisted for an
exclusive AICTE-approved Training & Internship Program offered by LearnFlu.

This 10-week program provides practical learning and hands-on internship
experience with leading MNCs and startups. You will receive expert training
in programming and your core domain, preparing you for top career
opportunities.
Program Highlights:

 âœ… Government-Approved Training â€“ Recognized for its industry relevance.
âœ… Learn from Experts â€“ Gain skills from top professionals.
âœ… Work with Leading Companies â€“ Opportunities with TCS, Google, IBM, and
more.
âœ… Internship Certificate & Placement Support â€“ Enhance your resume.
âœ… Flexible Learning Options â€“ Study at your convenience.

To secure your spot, fill out the application form below:

content:
Dear Students of A1 batch,

My MEUC102 BCME lab (Pinal Patel, Civil Department), usually Friday
2:20-3:20 pm, will be held Thursdays 12:10-1:10 pm in room 528B, starting

subject: New assignment: "Week-5"
snippet: Notification settings 24ME-EE-CL New assignment Week-5 1. List Manipulation: Given numbers = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50], write code to:Replace the second element with 25.Print the last three elements using
content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s?email%3D24ee001@charusat.edu.in&Email=24ee001@charusat.edu.in>
24ME-EE-CL  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzM3NDE4ODMwODEw?email%3D24ee001@charusat.edu.in&Email=24ee001@charusat.edu.in>
New assignment

Week-5
1. List Manipulation: Given numbers = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50], write code  
to:Replace the second element with 25.Print the last three elements using  
slicing.Double each element using list comprehension.
2. Tuple Manipulation: Given coordinates = (10, 20, 30, 40, 50), write code  
to:Attempt to replace the second element with 25 (observe the  
error).Convert the tuple to a list, modify it, and convert back to a  
tuple.Print the last three elements using slicing.
3. Set Manipulation:  Given unique_numbers = {10, 20, 30, 40, 50}, write  
code to:Add 60 to the set.Remove 30 from the set.Create a new set with each  
element squared.
4. Dictionary Manipulation: Given inventory = {"apples": 50, "bananas":  
25, "oranges": 30}, write code to:Update the quantity of "bananas" to  
40.Add a new item, "grapes" with quantity 35.Print items with a quantity >  
30.
Instructions

    - Write your ID number, aim, actual code, and output in an ipynb file as  
discussed in the lab session.
    - To download an ipynb file in Google Colab, go to the file menu and  
download the ipynb file.
    - The file name must be your ID number.
    - Feel free to contact me for any queries.
    - For every program, the first line will be the print function, which  
will print your ID number.

Due Apr 8
See details  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzM3NDE4ODMwODEw/a/NzUzMzU5NjE5MjU1/details?email%3D24ee001@charusat.edu.in&Email=24ee001@charusat.edu.in>

subject: Congratulations 24ee001! Youâ€™re Shortlisted for Summer Internship in final Phase from Kshitij IIT KHARAGPUR
snippet: Final Registration for Summer Internship 2025 For CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY Students Dear 24ee001, Congratulations on getting shortlisted for our new batch starting from APRIL, MAY, JUNE & JULY for the
content:
Final Registration for Summer Internship 2025 For CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY
Students

*Dear 24ee001,*


Congratulations on getting shortlisted for our new batch starting from
APRIL, MAY, JUNE & JULY for the Training & Internship Program.

*Note: If any of your batchmates have missed this notification or haven't
received it, please forward this email to them.*
*Important Update:*
All  students' exams have now been completed! We hope you did very well in
your exams. Itâ€™s time to complete your registration and take the next step
towards an exciting career.

*Students must Submit their Application. If you get shortlisted, you will
be contacted by our HR Team.*
 SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION HERE <https://forms.gle/FdTw9Wno4daLpAU97>
 Program Details:
First Month :
    Expert training designed with live lectures and mentorship from
industry professionals (10-15 years of experience). *(Login credentials
will be provided after registration)*

Second Month :
Internship with live mentorship for projects from professionals. The LIVE
INDUSTRY PROJECT will give students experience in solving real-world
problems.


   - *Project 1:* 10 individual projects assigned to each intern, to be
   completed with their mentor.
   - *Project 2:* Capstone Project: A group project assigned to a group of
   15 interns, with specific tasks for each intern. *(Essential data and
   materials required for the project will be provided by the company.)*

Class Format :

   - *Blended Program:* Access to recorded classes and live doubt-clearing
   sessions every weekend.
   - *Mentor-led/Live Classes:* Live Zoom classes at 6:30 PM for 2 to 3
   days a week, with recorded sessions available.
   - *LMS Portal:* Access for 6 months.


After Completion of the Program, Students will Receive :

   - âœ¨ *Program Completion Certificate* issued by *IIT KHARAGPUR KSHITIJ
   WITH WIPRO DICE ID*
   - âœ¨ *Co-Branded Internship Certificate* from *WIPRO, IBM, MICROSOFT,
   META, ADOBE*, and others.
   - âœ¨ *Letter of Recommendation* from MNCs.
   - âœ¨ Access to a *Growing Community*.
   - âœ¨ *100% Placement Assistance*.



*[This notification is for the enrollment of APRIL, MAY, JUNE, and JULY
batches for students who havenâ€™t been able to accept the scholarship slot
for the same. There are also options to upgrade in 2 months & 3 months.]*

          SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION HERE <https://forms.gle/FdTw9Wno4daLpAU97>
*
                                           Time Left To Apply*


  0d 10h30m 29s
If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to HR. Have a great day! âœ¨

*HR Team, Launched Global*

>> Dear Students,
>>
>> Please find the syllabus for 1st Internal (sessional) exam for BCME
>>
>> *1.*
>>
>> *Introduction of Mechanical Engineering*
>>
>> *06 Hours*
>>
>> *13%*
>>
>> 1.1
>>
>> Prime movers and its types, sources of energy
>>
>> 1.2
>>
>> Basic terminology: force and mass, pressure, work, power, energy, heat,
>> temperature, units of heat, specific heat capacity, interchange of heat,
>> change of state, internal energy, enthalpy, entropy, efficiency
>>
>> 1.3
>>
>> Zeroth law and first law of thermodynamics, Boyleâ€™s law, Charleâ€™s law and
>> combined gas law, Relation between Cp and Cv
>>
>> 1.4
>>
>> Constant volume process, constant pressure process, isothermal process,
>> poly-tropic process, adiabatic process
>>
>> 1.5
>>
>> Numerical practice
>>
>>
>> *2.*
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> *Steam and Steam Generator*
>>
>> 2.1
>>
>> Introduction to steam formation and its types
>>
>> 2.2
>>
>> Introduction to steam table
>>
>> 2.4
>>
>> Boiler definition and its classification
>>
>> 2.5
>>
>> Cochran boiler, Babcock and Wilcox boiler and its mountings and
>> accessories *(Lab Exp. 1 & 2)*
>>
>> 2.6
>>
>> Efficiencies of boiler
>>
>> *7.                  Scope of Civil Engineering*
>> 7.1               Scope of Civil engineering
>> 7.2               Branches of civil engineering,
>> 7.3                Role of civil engineer
>>
>> *8.                 Introduction to Surveying*
>> 8.1               Definition of surveying
>> 8.2              Objects of surveying, uses of surveying
>> 8.3              Primary divisions of surveying, principles of surveying
>> --
>>
>> Best Regards,
>>
>>
>>
>> Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar (M.Tech.| PhD)
>>
>> Assistant Professor
>>
>> Charotar University of Science & Technology
>>
>> +91 90992 23998 | abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in

subject: Presentation on Skill Augmentation 100 Activity points.
snippet: Dear Student, We have scheduled a session on the Skill Augmentation 100 Activity Points Course for first-year students on Wednesday, 2nd April 2025, at the CMPICA Auditorium. The session will be
content:
Dear Student,

We have scheduled a session on the Skill Augmentation 100 Activity Points
Course for first-year students on Wednesday, 2nd April 2025, at the CMPICA
Auditorium.

The session will be conducted in two slots:

ğŸ“Œ Slot 1: 10:10 AM â€“ 11:10 AM (CE/CSE/IT/CL) â€“    Total Students: 385

ğŸ“Œ Slot 2: 1:10 PM â€“ 2:10 PM (EC/AIML/EE/Mech) â€“ Total Students: 394

Venue: CMPICA Auditorium

You are requested to attend this presentation in your respective slot
without fail.
Regards,
-- 
Dr. Nilaykumar A. Patel
Associate professor & Head,
Electrical Engineering Dept.
Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT,
Changa. 388421, Ta: Petlad.
Phone:02697 265041

My Web Page: https://sites.google.com/charusat.ac.in/nilaypatel/home

--

subject: Re: Willingness Survey for Minor Projects â€“ B.Tech (EC/EE) Semester 2
snippet: Dear Students, As part of the minor project, you are required to finalize and submit your project title and group details. In our previous meeting, we discussed project ideas and the Week 1 approach.
content:
Dear Students,

As part of the *minor project*, you are required to *finalize and submit
your project title and group details*.

In our *previous meeting*, we discussed project ideas and the *Week 1
approach*. Based on this discussion, you should now decide on your project
title and finalize your group members (if applicable).

*Instructions:*

âœ” *Write your project title* in the provided section (choose from the
suggested list or propose your own).
âœ” If working in a *group*, mention the names and roll numbers of all group
members.
âœ” If working *individually*, write "Individual" in the group section.
âœ” Ensure that your project aligns with the discussed *Week 1 approach*.
âœ” The deadline for submission is *29**/03/2025*.

*TEAM CODE: *7b4j9v7

Link: https://forms.gle/pojm61MWqpMwnDfy5

Thanks & Regards


Dr. Niru C. Patel

Assistant  Professor,

Department of Mathematical Sciences,

Faculty of Science,

Charotar University of Science & Technology

CHARUSAT Campus

CHANGA,

TA. PETLAD

DIST. ANAND-388421 (GUJARAT)

INDIA

Ph: +91 2697 265190

Email ID: nirupatel.maths@charusat.ac.in <nirupatel.matcs@charusat.ac.in>

content:
Google Forms


Thanks for filling out Attitude of CHARUSAT Students towards Courses on  
Liberal Arts
Here's what was received.


Attitude of CHARUSAT Students towards Courses on Liberal Arts


Your email (24ee001@charusat.edu.in) was recorded when you submitted this  
form.


Student Name *


Atharva Jayant Chimote


Student ID
*


24EE001


Institute/College *


CSPIT



Course *


B.Tech



Specialization/Branch *


Electrical Engineering



Semester *


Sem-2



Liberal Arts *


Strongly agree Agree Neither agree nor disagree Disagree Strongly disagree

Liberal arts courses help me explore my creative side.


Liberal arts subjects feel irrelevant to my career goals.


Liberal arts courses add diversity to the university curriculum.


The inclusion of liberal arts subjects enhances the overall university  
experience.


I believe liberal arts courses should be optional for students in technical  
fields.


I enjoy participating in activities during liberal arts classes.


Liberal arts courses are exciting and fun.


Liberal arts courses encourage me to express my individuality.


Attending liberal arts classes is a refreshing change from my technical  
subjects.


Liberal arts courses have improved my creative problem-solving skills.


Liberal arts courses enhance my ability to work on team projects.


Liberal arts courses have made me more confident in public speaking.


Skills gained in liberal arts courses can be applied in my daily life.


The knowledge gained in liberal arts courses is relevant to modern  
professional settings.


I find it challenging to see the practical applications of liberal arts  
courses in my career.


Liberal arts education is essential for holistic personal and professional  
growth.


The creative assignments in liberal arts courses are harder than they seem.


Liberal arts courses should include a mix of theory and practical work for  
balanced learning.


Liberal arts courses have helped me appreciate diverse cultures and  
perspectives.


Liberal arts classes encourage collaboration and teamwork.


The teaching methods used in liberal arts courses are innovative and  
engaging.


Liberal arts faculty inspire creativity in their students.


My peers perceive liberal arts courses as less serious compared to  
technical courses.


Liberal arts courses provide a platform for socializing and networking.


Experiences in liberal arts courses build transferable skills that are  
valuable in any career.


Participating in liberal arts activities will enhance my resume or  
portfolio.


The ability to think creatively, gained from liberal arts, will help me  
adapt to diverse challenges.


Liberal arts education contributes to building a well-rounded personality.


More hands-on workshops and guest lectures would make liberal arts courses  
more appealing.


Interdisciplinary projects involving liberal arts and technical students  
would foster collaboration.


Subjects Studied *


HSUS105 Media and Graphic Design



HSUS105 Media and Graphic Design


HSUS105 Media and Graphic Design *


Strongly agree Agree Neither agree nor disagree Disagree Strongly disagree

The course has encouraged me to explore new and innovative design ideas.


I feel more confident in expressing my creativity through graphic design.


The assignments have allowed me to think outside the box and experiment  
with design.


The course provided me with a clear understanding of the basic principles  
of graphic design.


I can effectively use elements such as balance, contrast, and alignment in  
my designs.


The fundamentals taught in this course have helped me analyze and improve  
my design work.


The course has helped me understand the role of art and design in  
communication.


I have developed a greater appreciation for artistic expression and  
aesthetics.


Learning about art criticism has improved my ability to evaluate and refine  
designs.


I am more aware of how design impacts emotions and perceptions.


I can now identify and apply different design concepts in my work.


The course has helped me understand the impact of colors and shapes in  
visual communication.


I am more aware of how different printing techniques affect the final  
design output.


I have learned how to use different mediums effectively to create  
compelling designs.


I feel confident using graphic design software to create  
professional-quality work.


The hands-on experience with graphic tools has enhanced my technical design  
skills.


The practical exercises in this course helped me understand the  
capabilities of different graphic software.


The course has helped me understand current trends and challenges in  
graphic design.


I have gained insights into professional design techniques and industry  
practices.


The course has improved my ability to adapt to new tools and technologies  
in design.

subject: Liberal Arts - MGD - Project Submission Links
snippet: Dear Students Please note the revised evaluation scheme for Media and Graphic Design as follows: Internal Assessment External Assessment Project I (Pixel) 20 Project III (Calendar Design) 20 Project II
content:
Dear Students

Please note the revised evaluation scheme for *Media and Graphic Design* as
follows:

*Internal Assessment*



*External Assessment*

Project I (Pixel)

20



Project III (Calendar Design)

20

Project II (Logo and Visiting Card)

20



 Project 4 (Poster Design)

30

Attendance

10



*Total Marks*

*50*

*Total Marks*

*50*









Note: Your scores in Internal and External (each out of 50) will be scaled
to 25.

You may submit your Liberal Arts - MGD Project 1-4 using the following
links:

   - *Project 1 (Pixel Art) - *https://forms.gle/yQjJ5Bi8B4tAJQrDA
   - *Project 2 (Logo Design | Visiting Card) -*
   https://forms.gle/Gk6iGmJvtPqL66QG7
   - *Project 3 (Calendar) -* https://forms.gle/vT6TDkhnm1YZbW9u5
   - *Project 4 (Poster Design)* - https://forms.gle/gpUBUiQSGvCLvW2r7
   - *Course Feedback 1:* https://forms.gle/7BqSKCFmtfou8Bod7
   - *Course Feedback 2: * https://forms.gle/me6PossMjCbwS9xYA

Please make sure to use your official CHARUSAT email id for submission. [Note:
The responses will be accepted till 5:00 PM today (28/03/2025)]

venue.

subject: Poster Design Task â€“ Pixel Art for Equality
snippet: Dear Students, The Equal Opportunity Cell (EOC) of the Department of Computer Science Engineering (CSE), DEPSTAR is organizing a Media and Graphics Competition on the theme: "Digital Dialogues:
content:
Dear Students,

The *Equal Opportunity Cell (EOC)* of the *Department of Computer Science
Engineering (CSE), DEPSTAR* is organizing a *Media and Graphics Competition*
on the theme: *"Digital Dialogues: Visual Communication for Equality."*

As part of your *Media and Graphics Course*, you are required to
create a *poster
using a pixel graph sheet* provided during your lab session.
*What You Need to Do:*

   1.

   *Use the pixel graph sheet* you received in the lab.
   2.

   *Design a poster* in a pixel-style format based on the theme.
   3.

   *The theme is about equality*, so think of ideas that promote fairness,
   unity, and inclusivity.
   4.

   *You can create: (for example)*
   -

      Symbols of equality (e.g., handshake, balance scale, diverse people)
      5.

   *Color your design neatly* and ensure it is visually appealing.
   6.

   *Submit your work tomorrow morning* during the auditorium session.

*How Your Work Will Be Evaluated:*

   -

   Creativity & Originality
   -

   Relevance to the Theme
   -

   Neatness & Presentation

The *top 10 designs* will be shortlisted by *experts* for the final
selection of winners.

This is a great opportunity to showcase your creativityâ€”*give it your best
shot!* ğŸ¨âœ¨

Best regards,

[image: photo]
Dr. Vijay Makwana
Assistant Professor
Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
Charotar University of Science and Technology

[image: icon] 02697-265134  <02697-265184>  [image: icon] 9998380041

[image: icon] vijaymakwana.cs@charusat.ac.in

--

subject: Regarding Poster Presentation for BCME (MEUC102) on 19th April, 2025, Saturday
snippet: Dear Students, Hope this mail finds you well. CHAMOS Matrusanstha Department of Mechanical Engineering is going to organize the Poster presentation (MEUC102) for all first-year Mechanical, Civil and
content:
Dear Students,

Hope this mail finds you well.

CHAMOS Matrusanstha Department of Mechanical Engineering is going to
organize the Poster presentation (MEUC102) for all first-year Mechanical,
Civil and Electrical Engineering students on *19th April, 2025, Saturday*.

Please keep the following points in mind:

   1. The topic will be informed to you by next week. The topic, once
   fixed, will not be changed later.
   2. The weightage will be 10 marks as lab component.
   3. The size of the poster will be *A2 size*. The sample format is
   attached here for your reference. Don't change the size of the poster
   sample. You only need to insert the images and the text related to your
   topic, convert to PDF and take print on A2 size.
   4. Please convey your group (*max 2 in one group*) to your class CR [
   Vishwesh (24ME057) in Mechanical, Dhyey (24CL008) in Civil+ME, Priyansh
   (24EE004) in Electrical]
   5. Any other point, if needed, will be shared with you later.


Thank you.

Best Regards,



Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar (M.Tech.| PhD)

Assistant Professor

Charotar University of Science & Technology

+91 90992 23998 | abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in

content:

subject: Urmil & Mayuri Desai Family Trust Scholarship for 1st Year Students for the academic year (2024-25) of B.Tech Program.
snippet: Dear First Year CSPIT Students, We are pleased to announce Urmil & Mayuri Desai Family Trust Scholarship which will be awarded to the students of 1 st year of B.Tech program for academic year 2024-
content:
Dear First Year CSPIT Students,


We are pleased to announce Urmil & Mayuri Desai Family Trust Scholarship
which will be awarded to the students of 1st year of B.Tech program for
academic year 2024-25, with the following Criteria:



*Eligibility Criteria to get Scholarship for the Academic Year 2024-25:*

v Students of *1st Semester (1st year)* who have secured 75 percentage or
above in the 12th standard.

v Students whose family income is not more than 6.5 lacs.

v To continue to be eligible for availing Scholarship, the Student has to
secure 7.00 CGPA or above at the end of every semester without backlog.

v In case, a student will not score a minimum 7.00 CGPA in consecutive
semesters, then scholarship will be awarded to another eligible student,
selected by the Donor and recommended by CHARUSAT.

v Only four students shall be selected for the scholarship each semester.
Two boys and two girls. In case applicants of either gender are not
available, then all the four beneficiaries can be boys or girls.

v Students receiving Govt. / Donor / CHARUSAT / any other scholarship or
admitted under the Tuition Fee Waiver Scheme (TFWS) are not eligible to
apply.

v The Scholarship is meant to provide *maximum support to four students
selected by Donor, based on merit-cum-means and complying above conditions.*



*Scholarship Amount:*  Per Students 17500/- per semester (maximum four
students selected by the Donor)



 P*Please find the form and notice for your ready reference. You are
requested to submit the filled form to **Mr.Yatin Talati, **Room no.101,
EE/EC Building, CSPIT.*

*Last Date of Submission of Form:   08.04.2025*

 **Note: No Form will be accepted after the last date.*

-- 
Thanks,
*Yatin Talati*

Accredited Grade â€œA+â€ by NAAC, GOI

Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
Off. Nadiad - Petlad Highway, Changa, Gujarat, INDIA 388421
www.charusat.ac.in

--

snippet: Hello everyone! ğŸš€ Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics & Communication and Mechanical Department As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
content:
*Hello everyone! ğŸš€*

Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics &
Communication and Mechanical Department

As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
development on the Propulsion Systems, Design, Avionics, Recovery and
Material Science

We're thrilled to announce an exciting opportunity for all B.Tech students!
The Nakshatra Aerospace Club is officially recruiting new members, and we
want YOU to be a part of this Stellar journey into the world of Aerospace
innovation!


*Why Join Us?*

Being part of Nakshatra Aerospace means youâ€™ll engage in hands-on projects,
collaborate with like-minded peers, and prepare for interviews with
industry leaders. Plus, itâ€™s a fantastic way to enhance your resume!
Donâ€™t miss out on this incredible opportunity to soar high with Nakshatra
Aerospace! ğŸŒŒ

Looking forward to seeing your applications!

subject: Astronomy and Astrophysics Summer School 2025
snippet: Dear Students, PFA the details related to the opportunity to participate in the Astronomy & Astrophysics Summer School 2025, organized by India Space Academy. This is a month-long online summer
content:
Dear Students,

 PFA the details related to the opportunity to participate in the *Astronomy
& Astrophysics Summer School 2025*, organized by *India Space Academy*.
This is a *month-long online summer skill training programme* designed for
undergraduate students  interested in space science, astronomy, and
astrophysics.
*About the Programme:*

   -

   Gain exposure to the latest developments in *astronomy and astrophysics*.
   -

   Learn to operate *sophisticated research software* used by astronomers.
   -

   Receive *career guidance* for research and development in space science.
   -

   Enhance your *technical skills* for future opportunities in the field.

*Important Dates:*

ğŸ“… *Registration Opens:* 15th March 2025
ğŸ“… *Registration Closes:* 25th April 2025 (till 11:55 PM)

This is a great opportunity for students interested in *research, space
exploration, and career opportunities in astrophysics*. We encourage you to
take advantage of this internship and enhance your knowledge in this
fascinating field.

For more details and to register, visit:
https://isa.internship.indiaspaceweek.org/

A detailed *brochure is attached* with this email for your reference.

Feel free to reach out if you have any queries

--

snippet: Dear Students, Please go through the trailing mail. RGDS ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in> Date: Tue, Mar 25, 2025 at 4:50 PM Subject:
content:
Dear Students,
Please go through the trailing mail.
RGDS

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Mar 25, 2025 at 4:50â€¯PM
Subject: Fwd: Regarding the circulation of registration for Astronomy and
Astrophysics Summer School 2025
To: CSPIT <cspit@charusat.ac.in>


Please circulate to the students if anyone is interested in attending the
summer school.
Regards,
Trushit Upadhyaya

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <contact@isa.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Mar 25, 2025 at 1:32â€¯AM
Subject: Regarding the circulation of registration for Astronomy and
Astrophysics Summer School 2025
To: <director@isa.ac.in>


Respected Vice-Chancellor/Chairman/
Director/Principal/Dean/Registrar?Proctor/Head of Departments

Greetings from India Space Academy.

We are writing to inform you that India Space Academy has organized an
Astronomy & Astrophysics Summer School 2025. It is a month-long online
summer skill training programme for students and faculty. The objective
of the programme is to promote space education and employment by
training students and teachers with the skills required for research and
development in astronomy and astrophysics.

During this programme, participants will be exposed to the current
developments in astronomy and astrophysics. They will also be trained on
the skills and techniques required to run the sophisticated software
used by astronomers and researchers. They will also be guided toward a
career in the field of astronomy and astrophysics.
Please circulate this information to your university and its associated
colleges so that students can register for the programme and prepare
themselves for an exciting career as a researcher.

A detailed circular has been attached to this mail.

Registration Start Date: 15/03/2025
Registration End Date: 25/ 04/2025 till 11:55 PM
For more details and registration, visit
https://isa.internship.indiaspaceweek.org/

We look forward to your positive response. For any further
clarification, please contact us at the numbers provided.

subject: Important: Online Quiz Scheduled on March 29th â€“ Instructions Inside
snippet: Dear Students, The first online quiz is scheduled for March 29th from 11:20 to 11:30 AM. Please keep the following points in mind: The quiz consists of 5 MCQs and must be completed within 10 minutes.
content:
*Dear Students,*

The first online quiz is scheduled for *March 29th from 11:20 to 11:30 AM*.
Please keep the following points in mind:

   1.

   The quiz consists of *5 MCQs* and must be completed within *10 minutes*.
   2.

   Incorrect *ID inputs* will not be considered and will result in *zero
   marks*.
   3.

   Ensure you are in a *stable network environment*. Any *network or
   technical issues will not be considered*.
   4.

   The *Google Form link* will be sent to you via email on the day of the
   quiz.
   5.

   Login is allowed *only* using your *Charusat email ID*.
   6.

   For any queries, please write an email.

Best regards,
*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

*Mob. No: **+91-9427777856  *

subject: Important Internship Invitation_2nd Semester - Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) Student [NSDC & SKILL INDIA ACCREDITED CERTIFICATION]
snippet: DEAR STUDENTS OF Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) 2nd Semester PROGRAM UNDER {NATIONAL SKILL DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION} X {SKILL INDIA INITIATIVE} Warm Greetings! We are pleased
content:
*DEAR STUDENTS*


*OF**Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*
*2nd Semester*

*PROGRAM UNDER{NATIONAL SKILL DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION} X {SKILL INDIA
INITIATIVE}*
*Warm Greetings!*

We are pleased to share an incredible opportunity in partnership
withLaunchEd: a *2-Month Training and Internship Program* featuring
certifications from prestigious leading multinational organizations across
various fields.

*Who Can Apply?*
We invite applications from shortlisted students in all departments. If any
of your classmates haven't received this information, please feel free to
forward this email to them.

*It is Important for Interested Students to submit their application, if
shortlisted you will receive a response from our HR Team:*

Submit your Application
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeAZ7w57C483zdidyyDWu8KwgdbTHurWd9dRNL5aQME0ONcpQ/viewform?usp=header>

Vansh Muchhala BBA UG 1st CHARUSAT*Program Overview:*

*First Month: Training*

   - Participate in live lectures and receive guidance from industry
   professionals.
   - You will receive login details after the Registration Process.

*Second Month: Internship*

   - Engage in real-world projects with professional mentorship.
   - *Project Details:*
      - *Individual Assignments:* Complete 10 unique projects with your
      mentor.
      - *Group Capstone Project:* Collaborate in teams on a capstone
      project, with specific roles assigned to each intern. All necessary
      resources will be provided by the company.

*Class Formats:*

   1. *Blended Learning:*

      recorded sessions available for later review. You will also have
access to

*Certificates and Benefits:*

Upon completion, students will receive:

   - *100% Placement Assistance* and entry to a growing professional
   network.
   - Training on *Low-Code and No-Code Tools*.
   - Curriculum focused on *Generative AI and Prompt Engineering*.
   - Exclusive *Masterclasses* with industry leaders.
   - Personalized mentorship for tailored guidance.



*Donâ€™t miss out on this valuable opportunity!*
*Interested students should submit their applications to be part of this
transformative experience.*

content:
Dear Student,

Thank you for registering for the Liberal Arts course *"Media and Graphics"*,
scheduled from *25th to 28th March, 2025*.

Please note the following important instructions:

   1.

   Create a *Canva account* before the course begins.
   2.

   sessions.
   3.

   The institute will provide systems in the laboratory; however, you may
   bring your personal laptop as an optional backup in case of any unavoidable
   situation. This is not mandatory but recommended for your convenience.

Looking forward to your active participation.

Best regards,

Dr Vikas Raval

subject: Online Quiz 1 Notification for Engineering Physics - 2 (Experiments 5 to 9)
snippet: Dear First-Year Students, The Department of Physical Sciences is conducting an online quiz for Engineering Physics - 2, covering Experiments 5 to 9. Please find the details below: Date: 29/03/2025 Day:
content:
Dear First-Year Students,

The Department of Physical Sciences is conducting an online quiz for
Engineering Physics - 2, covering Experiments 5 to 9. Please find the
details below:

*Date:* 29/03/2025

*Day:* Saturday

*Time:* 4:00 PM to 4:30 PM

*Mode:* Online (Google Form)

*Total Marks:* 25 MCQs

*Evaluation Component:* Continuous Assessment

The Google Form link for the quiz will be shared on the day of the exam. I
just wanted to let you know that *no excuses related to internet*
connectivity issues will be entertained. Just so you know, this quiz is
part of your *continuous evaluation*, and failing to attempt it will
significantly impact your overall grades as per NEP.

The components for internal evaluation (25 Marks).

Quiz 1

Quiz 2

Lab Manual

Journal

20%

20%

20%

40%

Ensure your availability and preparedness for the quiz. For any queries,
feel free to reach out to your lab-in-charge for further assistance.

Best regards,
Sanni


-- 
*Thanks,*



*Sanni, Ph.D.Assistant professorDepartment of Physical Sciences
<https://www.charusat.ac.in/PDPIAS/people/>Faculty of Applied SciencesP D
Patel Institute of Applied Sciences,CHARUSAT
<https://www.charusat.ac.in/>, Changa. - 388 421, India*

*            sunkapatel@gmail.com <sunkapatel@gmail.com>*
*Phone: (M) +91 - 9978577009*

content:

New assignment

Week-4
Write a Python program to count vowels and consonants in a string.Write a  
Python program to reverse a string.Write a Python program to check if a  
string is a palindrome.Write a Python program to Find the Longest Word in a

will print your ID number.

subject: Fwd: Liberal Arts - Media and Graphics Design (HSUS105)
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings! As you are aware, the Department of Humanities and Social Sciences (HSS) under Faculty of Humanities (FoH) offers a compulsory 2-credit course on Liberal Arts as part of your
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings!

As you are aware, the  *Department of Humanities and Social Sciences*
*(HSS)* under *Faculty of Humanities (FoH)*  offers a compulsory 2-credit
course on Liberal Arts as part of your academic requirements. We are
pleased to know that you have been enrolled in the *Media and Graphic
Design* (*HSUS105*) Course.

The course will be conducted in Workshop Mode from *9:10 am to 4:30 pm*
 during *25th to 28th March,2025* at CHARUSAT Campus, Changa. We expect you
to adhere to the following important instructions:

Â·       *100% attendance is compulsory.*

Â·       *Your internal, as well as external evaluation, will be carried out
during these 4 days of the Liberal Arts workshop.*

Â·       *Completion of all assignments, tasks, and activities assigned
during the Liberal Arts Workshop is mandatory.*

*Â·       Non-compliance or absence may result in an FF Grade/Backlog in the
course.*

Â·       Please check  Gmail regularly for updates.

Â·       Carry your Identity Card and wear it throughout the  days of the
Liberal Arts Workshop.

Â·       Details of the syllabus/schedule/venue of the course will be
provided in your Kit letter.

Â·       To gain a better understanding of the domain, we encourage you to
undergo some online courses and access YouTube videos. The details about
the same will be  shared in the Kit Letter & on Teams.

Â·       *Carry your laptop if you have consented to carry your device.*

For any queries, please contact *Dr Vijay Makwana* (9998380041/
vijaymakwana.cs@charusat.ac.in) or *Dr Vikas Raval* (9429356638/
vikasraval.cs@charusat.ac.in)

Alternatively, you may also contact the Institute Liberal Arts Coordinators
and/or your Mentor if you have any queries.

We believe that this course will provide a rich learning experience, and we
look forward to your active participation.

Thank you.

Regards,
*Thanks & Regards*

*Dr  Vikas Raval *
*9429356638*

--

subject: Fwd: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making Competition Details
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: DHRUVI MAHALE <22cs036@charusat.edu.in> Date: Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:07 PM Subject: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: DHRUVI MAHALE <22cs036@charusat.edu.in>
Date: Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:07â€¯PM
Subject: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making
Competition Details
To: <coordinator.nss@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: <pinalhansora.cse@charusat.ac.in>, <22cs051@charusat.edu.in>


Respected Sir,

I hope this email finds you well.

We, the *CSE NSS Unit*, are organizing a *Traffic Awareness Program* on *20th
March 2025* to spread awareness about road safety and responsible driving
among students. As part of this initiative, we are hosting a *Poster Making
Competition* on *18th March 2025*.

ğŸ“Œ *Competition Details:*

   - Open to all students of *Charusat University*
   - Teams of *2 or 3 members* can participate
   - Only *20 teams* will be selected on a *first-come, first-serve* basis
   - The best posters will be showcased at the *Traffic Awareness Program*
   - *Participants must bring their own laptops for designing the poster  *

We request you to kindly forward this information to all departments so
that interested students can participate. They can register by filling out
the form linked below:

Attached is the *poster for the event* for further reference.
[image: image.png]

For any queries, students can contact:
ğŸ“  *9328068864 **, *99790 99218

We appreciate your support in spreading the word about this initiative.
Looking forward to your kind cooperation.

Best Regards,
Dhruvi mahale

content:
*Dear Student of Charusat University,*

*"INTERNSHIPS DONâ€™T JUST ADD TO YOUR RESUME; THEY DEFINE YOUR FUTURE. GET
AHEAD BEFORE THE WORLD LEAVES YOU BEHIND ğŸŒ"*

*INTERNSHIP WITH NSDC CERTIFICATION!*

2-Month Summer Training + Internship Program will now receive an *NSDC
(National Skill Development Corporation)  and WIPRO DICE ID Certification* â€“
a valuable credential that can be used for *placement and college purposes*.

subject: Important: MSUD102 Practice Session Starting from March 18, 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Your tutorial (Practice Session for MSUD102) will commence on March 18, 2025. This session is part of continuous evaluation, and your attendance is mandatory. If you are absent for even
content:
Dear Students,

Your tutorial (Practice Session for MSUD102) will commence on *March 18,
2025*. This session is part of *continuous evaluation*, and your attendance
is *mandatory*.

*If you are absent for even one session, we will inform your parents*.
Please ensure your participation to avoid any issues.

 Each class has been divided into *two equal partitions*, and sessions will
be conducted by *two different faculty members*. Please *check your ID
number in the attached file* and ensure that you always *sit in your
allotted classroom* throughout the sessions.

Thank you.
*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

*Mob. No: **+91-9427777856  *

subject: Invitation to Participate in Viksit Bharat Youth Parliament 2025
snippet: Dear Students, The CHARUSAT NSS Cell is pleased to invite you to participate in the Viksit Bharat Youth Parliament 2025, an incredible opportunity to express your vision for a developed India. This
content:
Dear Students,

The *CHARUSAT NSS Cell* is pleased to invite you to participate in the *Viksit
Bharat Youth Parliament 2025*, an incredible opportunity to express your
vision for a developed India. This initiative, supported by the *Ministry
of Youth Affairs & Sports, Govt. of India*, encourages youth engagement in
policy discussions and leadership development.
*Event Details:*

*District-Level Competition:* 17th March 2025
*Venue:* Sardar Patel University, Vallabh Vidyanagar

*Register Here:* https://mybharat.gov.in/ -> Viksit Bharat Youth Parliament
2025 <https://mybharat.gov.in/mega_events/viksit-bharat-youth-parliament>
(*Register as soon as possible!*)
*Deadline : 16th March 2025*
*Participation Guidelines:*

   - Open to students aged *18-25 years*.
   - Submit a *1-minute video* on the topic: *"What does Viksit Bharat mean
   to you?"*
   - Language options: *Gujarati, Hindi, or English*.
   - *Selected 150 participants* will compete at the District Level.
   - *Top 10* will advance to the State Level, and winners will qualify for
   the *National Level* competition.

For detailed guidelines and further information, please find the *attached
PDF*.

*We encourage all eligible students to take advantage of this opportunity
and make CHARUSAT proud! *

For any queries, feel free to contact the *CHARUSAT **NSS Cell*.
-- 
Thanks & Regards
--

--

subject: Regarding: B. Tech. Second Semester Midterm Exam-Instruction to Students
snippet: Dear Students, It has been observed on Day 1 (today) of the B. Tech. Second Semester Midterm exam, students are reporting late for examination. You are instructed to report to your exam place at 10:10
content:
Dear Students,

It has been observed on Day 1 (today) of the B. Tech. Second Semester
Midterm exam, students are reporting late for examination.

You are instructed *to report to your exam place at 10:10 am sharp without
fail *for further examination.

The entry of the multiutility building will be closed at 10:20 am from
tomorrow onwards. Therefore, please enter the building on or before that
without fail. It is advised *to enter the building at 10:00 am *for smooth
execution.

You are constantly observed on camera so don't make any kind of copies or
talk during the exam. You can contact the respective exam supervisor during
the exam if you have any queries.

Thank You.

Best of Luck for further exams.
---

Regards,



*Dr. Sagar Chokshi,*

Associate Professor,
Department of Mechanical Engineering,

Faculty of Technology & Engineering,

snippet: Dear Students, I would like to inform you that I will be on leave from March 17 to March 20. I have arranged most of my lectures with respected faculty members. However, some lectures have already been
content:
Dear Students,

I would like to inform you that I will be on *leave from March 17 to March
20*. I have arranged most of my lectures with respected faculty members.
However, some lectures have already been conducted in advance as part of
the rearrangement, while others will be scheduled in the future.

For your reference, I have shared a *detailed table* outlining the
adjustments. Any lectures taken in advance have been conducted in *LR/SA*,
and I will compensate for *LR/SA slots* in my future lectures.
Additionally, some lectures in the upcoming dates have been rescheduled
accordingly.

 *The lectures not mentioned here have already been assigned to other
faculty members and are not free lectures.*

If you have any queries, please reach out to your *Class Representative

subject: The Quill: CHARUSAT Chronicles | Volume 10 - Issue 2
snippet: Welcome to Quill The Quill: CHARUSAT Chronicles Greetings from CHARUSAT! In the ever-evolving journey of academic excellence and innovation, we are delighted to introduce Quill â€” the official
content:
[Welcome to Quill]
[https://mailer.charusat.org.in/index.php/campaigns/pj902x2k39ea7/track-url/ls409tohbwc79/cde86d8c0da7b957c934ecfd99c713dcf0d13606]


THE QUILL: CHARUSAT CHRONICLES

Greetings from CHARUSAT!

In the ever-evolving journey of academic excellence and innovation, we
are delighted to introduce QUILL â€” the official newsletter of
CHARUSAT. True to its name, Quill embodies the spirit of creativity,
intellect, and expression that defines our vibrant community.

WHATâ€™S INSIDE QUILL?

 	* ACCOLADES: CHARUSAT'S EXCELLENCE â€“ Celebrating extraordinary
accomplishments of our students, faculty, and alumni.
 	* RESEARCH PUBLICATIONS: THE EDGE OF EXPLORATION â€“ Showcasing
groundbreaking discoveries.
 	* EMINENT SPEAKERS: UNVEILING NEW PERCEPTIONS â€“ Dive into engaging
conversations and transformative ideas.
 	* CAMPUS BUZZ: CELEBRATING CAMPUS LIFE â€“ Experience the energy and
excitement of campus life.
 	* FACULTY SPOTLIGHT: ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE â€“ Highlighting the
brilliance of our faculty.
 	* STUDENT SPOTLIGHT: RISING STARS â€“ Inspiring stories of our
student community.

Quill is more than just a newsletter; it is a chronicle of our shared
vision, growth, and success. Join us in celebrating the milestones and
moments that make CHARUSAT a hub of inspiration and innovation.

subject: Hands on Workshop on HIgh Performance Computing under Super Computing Facility @ CHARUSAT
snippet: Hands-On Workshop on High Performance Computing Organized by Supercomputing Facility at CHARUSAT & AIML Club at CHARUSAT Dear Students and Faculty members, We are excited to invite you to a two-day
content:
Hands-On Workshop on High Performance Computing

Organized by Supercomputing Facility at CHARUSAT & AIML Club at CHARUSAT

Dear Students and Faculty members,

We are excited to invite you to a two-day hands-on workshop on High
Performance Computing (HPC) at CHARUSAT. This workshop will provide you
with practical experience in parallel computing techniques and technologies.
*Workshop Details:*

ğŸ“… Date: 11-12 March 2025

ğŸ“ Venue: 323A, A6 Building

ğŸ‘¥ Maximum participants: 40

ğŸ’° Registration: Free of cost

*Note:* E-certificates will be provided to participants with 100%
attendance and 100% allocated task submission.
About the Workshop

This workshop will introduce you to the Supercomputing Facility at
CSPIT-CHARUSAT. You'll gain hands-on experience with various parallel
computing paradigms including:

   - â€¢ GPU Programming with CUDA
   - â€¢ Shared Memory Parallelism with OpenMP
   - â€¢ Distributed Memory Parallelism with MPI
   - â€¢ Multi-GPU training with PyTorch

Workshop Schedule
Time Day 1 (March 11) Day 2 (March 12)
9:10 AM - 10:00 AM Super computing in action - Transforming Science and
Innovation
Dr. Amit Thakkar
10:00 AM - 12:00 PM Shared Memory Parallelism with OpenMP
Dr. Ritesh Patel GPU Programming with CUDA (continued)
Dr. Ritesh Patel
12:00 PM - 1:00 PM Lunch Break Lunch Break
1:00 PM - 2:00 PM Shared Memory Parallelism with OpenMP (continued)
Dr. Ritesh Patel Multi-GPU training with PyTorch
Mr. Harshal Yagnik
2:00 PM - 4:20 PM Distributed Memory Parallelism with MPI
Mr. Harshal Yagnik Multi-GPU training with PyTorch (continued)
Mr. Harshal Yagnik
Benefits

   - â€¢ Hands-on experience with the Supercomputing Facility
   - â€¢ Learn from experts in the field of high-performance computing
   - â€¢ E-certificates for participants with 100% attendance and task
   completion
   - â€¢ Valuable skills for research and industry applications

Registration Information

The workshop is open to all students and faculty members. Registration is
required as seats are limited to 40 participants.

Limited seats available - Register today!
Register Now <#>

Registration closes on March 9, 2025 or when all seats are filled

Organized by Supercomputing Facility at CHARUSAT & AIML Club |
CSPIT-CHARUSAT

"EMPOWERING THE POTENTIAL OF PARALLEL COMPUTING"


With Regards,

Amit Thakkar, Ph.D.
Professor & Head
Department of Computer Science & Engineering
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology (CSPIT)
Charotar University of Science & Technology.(CHARUSAT)
Jay Swaminarayan.

--

subject: Fwd: Inauguration of IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch - Women in Engineering (WIE)
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in> Date: Fri, 7 Mar 2025, 9:36 am Subject: Inauguration of IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch - Women in
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, 7 Mar 2025, 9:36â€¯am
Subject: Inauguration of IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch - Women in
Engineering (WIE)
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>



Inauguration of IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Women in Engineering Affinity
Group and Seminar talk on "Women Innovators in Tech: Success Stories and
Lessons Learned"

Newly Established IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Women in Engineering
Affinity Group invites all female students and faculties of CHARUSAT to
participate in the inauguration ceremony followed by a seminar talk.
About IEEE WIE

*Vision:* "To be globally recognized for its contributions in STEM fields.
Our goal is to facilitate the recruitment and retention of women in
technical disciplines globally. We envision a vibrant community of IEEE
women and men collectively using their diverse talents to innovate for the
benefit of humanity."

*Mission:* "To connect, support, and inspire women and girls worldwide, and
facilitate their recruitment and retention in STEM fields, fostering
technological innovation and excellence for the benefit of humanity."
Guest Speaker
Ruzan Khambatta

A visionary entrepreneur, social innovator, and passionate advocate for
women's empowerment. Through her groundbreaking initiatives like Wajra O'
Force, PoliceHEART 1091, and Halla Bol, she has transformed thousands of
lives. Her success mantra? Small steps today lead to giant leaps tomorrow!

Learn more about Ruzan Khambatta <https://ruzankhambatta.com/wizzo1/>
Event Details

   - *Date:* *10th March 2025*
   - *Time:* *9:45 AM to 11:00 AM*
   - *Venue:* *2nd floor, Seminar hall, CSPIT EC-EE(A6 building), CHARUSAT*

This event is a milestone moment as we officially launch the Student
Chapter of WiE Society of IEEE, a dedicated community to uplift and support
women in technology. Whether you're a student, professional, or tech
enthusiast, this is an opportunity to connect, learn, and be part of a
movement that drives change.

E-Certificates will be provided to all the participants.

Let's come together to celebrate, empower, and innovate!
Register Here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1YtXFaNHx3A12jsPhcPr6jRjZWwjOh48EskA9I3Ra9Mg/edit>

Looking forward to your presence!

Regards,

-- 
Dr. Trushit Upadhyaya
Professor & I/c Principal
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology
Faculty of Technology & Engineering
Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT)
CHARUSAT Campus, Changa, 388421
Petlad, Anand, Gujarat, India.
M: 7874840344
https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Gzsxo-oAAAAJ&hl=en

--

subject: Certified Ethical Hacker v13 (CEHv13) - Worldâ€™s No. 1 Ethical Hacking Certification, now with the power of AI (March 2025)
snippet: Dear students, We are glad to inform you that "Charotar University of Science and Technology - CHARUSAT" is the official EC-Council Academia Partner since January 2020. We are immensely
content:
Dear students,

We are glad to inform you that *"Charotar University of Science and
Technology - CHARUSAT"* is the official *EC-Council Academia Partner *since
January 2020. We are immensely pleased to welcome â€œCHARUSATâ€ *students* to
EC Council's newly launched *CEHv13* program. Certified Ethical
Hacker CEHv13
<https://www.eccouncil.org/programs/certified-ethical-hacker-ceh/> will
teach you the latest commercial-grade hacking tools, techniques, and
methodologies hackers and information security professionals use to hack an
organization lawfully. *110+ students have benefited from CEH at CHARUSAT
with a subsidized academia kit price.*

*Whatâ€™s new in CEHv13?*: *From the creators of Certified Ethical Hacker
(CEH) comes the latest and evolved version 13 with added AI capabilities.
Structured across 20 learning modules covering over 550 attack techniques,
CEH provides cybersecurity professionals with the core knowledge they need
to detect and defend against emerging threats.*

*You will get:*

   - EC-Council Official Course Book for CEHv13 for self-study (24 Months) -
   Accessible Online/Offline. To Download App
   <https://support.vitalsource.com/hc/en-us/articles/201344733-Bookshelf-Download-Options>

   - Access To iLabs for 6 Months. Check the ilabs Demo Here:
   *https://youtu.be/iU_7zKypJZI* <https://youtu.be/iU_7zKypJZI>.
   - An Exam Voucher (1 Year) - *Get a globally recognized certificate
for* passing
   the exam. Accreditations
   <https://linkprotect.cudasvc.com/url?a=https%3a%2f%2fwww.eccouncil.org%2faccreditations%2f&c=E,1,hLej6Kb3ZRL_QKhhm71kedMm89bbj8UclU3d50zuCt2frG_t19Fir_60SvUk16RJBGYXwVBLF11HLMhr7nDv8WGkPElWNiTm9zdZ_xfo&typo=1>
   - Over 200 hands-on labs with Over 3,500 hacking tools. Learn how to
   hack multiple operating systems (Windows 11, Windows servers, Linux,
   Ubuntu, Android)
   - The venue of the Exam will be our University Premises.

*Popular Cybersecurity Tools in the Course:*


* - Network scanning and mapping tools (e.g., Nmap, hping3)- Vulnerability
assessment tools (e.g., OpenVAS, Nessus)- Penetration testing tools (e.g.,
Metasploit, Aircrack-ng)- Packet sniffers and network analyzers (e.g.,
Wireshark, Omnipeek Network Analyzer)- Social engineering tools (e.g.,
Social-Engineer Toolkit (SET), SpeedPhish Framework (SPF))- Password
cracking tools (e.g., John the Ripper, L0phtCrack)- Forensics tools (e.g.
FTK, EnCase, Autopsy)- Wireless hacking tools (e.g., Aircrack-ng,
Wifiphisher)- Encryption tools (e.g., CryptoForge, VeraCrypt)*
*Master AI to automate ethical hacking tasks and hack and defend against AI
systems.*

*â€¢ ShellGPT* â€“ Automates various reconnaissance and penetration testing
tasks using AI-driven scripting.
*â€¢ ChatGPT *â€“ Helps generate code, automate tasks, and create scripts for
ethical hacking.
â€¢ *FraudGPT* â€“ Simulates AI-assisted malicious activities to learn defense
strategies.
â€¢ *WormGPT* â€“ An offensive AI tool used to simulate exploitations and
malware creation.
â€¢ *DeepExploit* â€“ AI-powered vulnerability scanning and exploitation tool.
â€¢ *Nebula* â€“ Automates network discovery and vulnerability identification
with AI.
â€¢ *Veed.io* â€“ Can visualize security analytics and post-exploitation
results for better reporting.


*Typical Job Roles for C|EH :*

   - Mid-Level Information Security Auditor
   - Cybersecurity Auditor
   - Security Administrator
   - IT Security Administrator
   - Cyber Defense Analyst
   - Senior Security Consultant
   - Information Security Manager
   - Senior SOC Analyst
   - Solution Architect
   - Cybersecurity Consultant



   - Vulnerability Assessment Analyst
   - Warning Analyst
   - Information Security Analyst 1
   - Security Analyst L1
   - Infosec Security Administrator
   - Cybersecurity Analyst L1, L2, & L3
   - Network Security Engineer
   - SOC Security Analyst
   - Security Analyst
   - Network Engineer

*Webinar on "A Career in Cybersecurity" by EC-Council with Collaboration of
CHARUSAT | Campus Official: *https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X-QgxO3JhlA


*Testimonials:*

   - How Certified Ethical Hacker Helped Me Land a Job with Big4 | Sidhant
   Gupta <https://youtu.be/PLvVyh96n8M?si=IVLEptb5F-QPMUaw>
   - Catch Your Big Break in Cybersecurity with C|EH | Ravina Joshi
   <https://youtu.be/TO7veOnV9T4?si=uzHTokSpVAtp1iOm>
   - How C|EH Helped Me Build a Successful Career in Cybersecurity
   <https://youtu.be/SZ8tmKzyBh4?si=TZpSsdfrCeZf2I2j>

subject: Regarding Industrial tour guidelines and Route map (06/03/25 to 09/03/25)
snippet: Dear All, Please find the following schedule for Industrial tour at Adani Thermal power station Dahanu, Maharashtra: Schedule: Name of Industry: Adani Thermal power station, Dahanu Date of Visit: 07/03
content:
Dear All,

Please find the following schedule for Industrial tour at Adani Thermal
power station Dahanu, Maharashtra:

*Schedule:*
Name of Industry: Adani Thermal power station, Dahanu
Date of Visit: 07/03/2025  (Duration of tour: 06/03/25 to 09/03/25)
*Date & Time of Departure: 06/03/25, 08:00 PM, Near Water Tank, Charusat
Campus*
Time of Arrival: Approximately 11 AM to 12:00 afternoon, Charusat Campus

Route Map: Charusat Campus>>Anand(Sanket India, Indira circle, Samarkha
chokdi)>>Vadodara Bypass(Ajawa Chokdi, Halol Chokdi, Waghodia Chokdi,Dabhoi
Chokdi, Dhaniyavi
Chokdi>>Karjan>>Bharuch>>Kamrej>>Navsari>>Vasad>>Talasri>>Dahanu

*In this regard, **Each student has to submit the  hard copy of parent's
undertaking & Hostel Permission Form by tomorrow between 11:10AM to 12:10
PM at Room No. 131.*


*Students are requested to adhere the following rules and regulations
inside the Adani Thermal Power Plant, Dahanu premises.*

   1. Photography is strictly prohibited in the plant during the visit.
   2. Students are not allowed to touch any electrical equipment during
   their visit.
   3. Students are required to follow all the instructions during their
   visit given by Adani Thermal Power Plant personnel.
   4. Students are must be in formal wear. Shoes are compulsory.
   5. Students must bring ID card, Fee Receipt, Adharcard or any Government
   approved ID card, pen and notepad or notebook to write.



*Thanks & Regards*

*Ankur Patel*




*Assistant Professor,M & V Patel Department of Electrical
Engineering,Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology, Changa - 388
421,Charotar University of Science and Technology,Dist: Anand, Gujarat,
India*
*(Accredited by NBA, India)*
*(Accredited with "Grade A+" by NAAC, India)*

subject: Important Email: Clarification on Syllabus and Reading Material
snippet: Dear Students, In my last email, I shared the syllabus, and some of you raised concerns about a mismatch in section numbering. To clarify, please refer to the following reading material for Unit 2 and
content:
Dear Students,

In my last email, I shared the syllabus, and some of you raised concerns
about a mismatch in section numbering. To clarify, please refer to the
following reading material for *Unit 2* and *Unit 5* to verify the
syllabus. Do not get confused.

   - *Unit 2:* Up to *Subsection 2.2* (*Complementary Functions and Their
   Examples*). Please check *Subsection 2.2* in this reading material.
   - *Unit 5:* Only *Section 5.3* (*Evaluation of Double Integrals and Its
   Examples*), *excluding Sections 5.1 and 5.2*.  Please check *Subsection
   5.3* in this reading material

If you still have any doubts, feel free to contact me.

Best regards,
*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

*Mob. No: **+91-9427777856  *

subject: (CHARUSAT STUDENTS ) LAUNCHED KSHITIJ IIT KHARAGPUR INTERNSHIP PROGRAM
snippet: Dear Students Warm greetings From LaunchED Kshitij 2025 (IIT), Kharagpur We are thrilled to share an exceptional opportunity tailored for the creative minds of Batch 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024. In
content:
*Dear Students*

Warm greetings From *LaunchED *Kshitij 2025 (IIT), Kharagpur

We are thrilled to share an exceptional opportunity tailored for the
creative minds of *Batch 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024*. In collaboration with
*LaunchED * Kshitij 2025 (IIT), Kharagpur we present a *two-month Training
and Internship Program* featuring certifications from global leaders, and
other renowned organizations.

*Who Can Apply?*

We invite applications from shortlisted students across all departments. If
any of your classmates have not received this information, please forward
this email to them.


https://forms.gle/jALGvwB63X9Up12D8
*Program Highlights*

   -

   *Month 1: Training*
   - Live industry-led sessions and recorded materials.
   -

   *Month 2: Internship*
   - Hands-on individual projects and a group capstone project with
      professional mentorship.

*Key Benefits*

   -
   - *Certificate of Completion* from  *LaunchED * Kshitij 2025 (IIT),
   Kharagpur
   - *Verified certification* via Wipro Dice ID.
   - *Co-branded Internship Certificate* from leading MNCs.
   - *100% Placement Assistance* and access to an expanding professional
   network.
   - Training on *Low-Code and No-Code Tools* and *Generative AI* concepts.
   - Invitations to *Exclusive Masterclasses* hosted by industry leaders.
   - *Personalized mentorship* for tailored career development.

-- 



To know more on us, Please click on any of the following links;












 <https://www.facebook.com/acharya.ac.in>

<https://twitter.com/acharya_ac_in>

<https://in.linkedin.com/school/acharya-institutes/>

*The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Department at Charotar
University of Science and Technology is pleased to invite you to
participate in our upcoming Equal Opportunity Cell (EOC) Activity on the
theme "**AI for Social Good â€“ Solving Real-World Issues**"*
Date: 7th March 2025
Timing: 12:00 to 2:00 pm
Registration Link: https://forms.gle/4dnzcafVqqNKr8cd9
Rules:

   -

   Students may present AI-based solutions for improving daily life,
   supporting disabled individuals, enhancing healthcare, or addressing social
   causes.

   Students may submit their ideas in a group of up to 3 members.
   -

   Poster Presentation size: A2 *(presentation format is attached
   herewith.)*
   -

   The poster presentation must be in hard copy.

*Exciting Prizes:*

*1st Prize: â‚¹1500/-*

*2nd Prize: â‚¹1000/-*
*3rd Prize: â‚¹500/-*

   - All participants will receive an e-Certificate of Participation.

We request your kind cooperation and adherence to the above rules to ensure
the smooth conduct of the event.



-


*Thanks and Regards,*


*Gaurang A. Patel*

*Assistant Professor*

Department of Mechanical Engineering

Functional Dept: Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning

Charotar University of Science & Technology

subject: TRAINING AND INTERNSHIP DRIVE WITH PLACEMENT ASSISTANCE
snippet: Dear Student, Secure a place in LaunchED Global prestigious 2-Month Training + Internship Program with the credential of WIPRO DICE ID certification. STUDENT WILL RECEIVE: Comprehensive Training &
content:
*Dear Student,*

*Secure a place in LaunchED Global prestigious **2-Month Training +
Internship Program *with the credential of* WIPRO DICE ID *certification.
*STUDENT WILL RECEIVE:*

   1. *Comprehensive Training & Mentorship*
      - *Month 1:* Live interactive sessions with industry leaders using
      your personalized learning portal.
      - *Month 2:* Real-world internship projects under the guidance of
      experts.
   2. *Industry-Recognized Certifications*
      - Course Completion Certificate.
      - Internship Certificate from *top MNCs* verified by Wipro Dice ID.
   3. *Professional Skill Development*
      - Gain expertise in cutting-edge technologies like *Generative
AI*, *Prompt
      Engineering*, and *Low/No-Code Applications*.
      - Exclusive guest lectures from leaders at *Microsoft* and *Meta*.

*Exclusive Benefits:*

   - A* 6-month *access to an* LMS portal* with personalized options.
   - *Placement assistance* through a dedicated growth community.
   - 24/7 *personalized mentorship* and live doubt-clearing sessions.

*Application Details: *

   - *First come first serve*
   - *Application Form:* *https://forms.gle/fMsqcKp26ZbqxmPg6*
   <https://forms.gle/fMsqcKp26ZbqxmPg6>

*Stay Updated:*

This program is a stepping stone for those aspiring to *excel in their
careers*. Donâ€™t miss this opportunity to *enhance your skills* and *gain
credentials* recognized by leading industries.

*For those already enrolled, please disregard this email.*

Best regards,
*LaunchED Global*

New assignment

Week-3
1. Program to find the first number greater than 10 that is divisible by 3  
using the break keyword.
2. Program to keep asking for input until the user enters "quit" using the  
break keyword.
3. Program to print numbers from 1 to 10, skipping 5 and 7 using the  
continue keyword.
4. Print prime numbers between 1 and 100

Dear All,

Weâ€™re excited to announce the upcoming *UniExplore 2.0 International Fair*
 at *Charusat University* on *February 28th* â€“ a must-attend event for
students aspiring to study abroad! âœ¨

*Hereâ€™s what you can look forward to:*

   1.

   *On-the-Spot Counseling*
   Direct guidance from university representatives, answering all your
   study abroad questions.
   2.

   *Complete Guidance for Education Loans*
   Get a clear understanding of the documentation and loan process
   step-by-step.
   3.

   *Exclusive Scholarships*
   Discover scholarship opportunities for studying in top destinations like
   the *USA, UK, Canada, NZ, Australia*, and *Germany*.
   4.

   *One-to-One Profile Evaluation*
   After pre-counseling, meet university reps tailored to your profile for
   more personalized advice.

This event is a your *gateway to transforming their future* and gaining
clarity about your educational journey.

Mark your calendars for *February 28th*, and take your first step toward
international education.

*Venue: Central Lawn, CHARUSAT*

*Date: 28 FEB 2025*

We look forward to seeing you there and helping you take the next big step
in students academic journey!

subject: Syllabus for 1st internal of BCME (MEUC102) on 12/03/2025
snippet: Dear Students, Please find the syllabus for 1st Internal (sessional) exam for BCME 1. Introduction of Mechanical Engineering 06 Hours 13% 1.1 Prime movers and its types, sources of energy 1.2 Basic
content:
Dear Students,

Please find the syllabus for 1st Internal (sessional) exam for BCME

*1.*

*Introduction of Mechanical Engineering*

*06 Hours*

*13%*

1.1

Prime movers and its types, sources of energy

1.2

Basic terminology: force and mass, pressure, work, power, energy, heat,
temperature, units of heat, specific heat capacity, interchange of heat,
change of state, internal energy, enthalpy, entropy, efficiency

1.3

Zeroth law and first law of thermodynamics, Boyleâ€™s law, Charleâ€™s law and
combined gas law, Relation between Cp and Cv

1.4

Constant volume process, constant pressure process, isothermal process,
poly-tropic process, adiabatic process

1.5

Numerical practice


*2.*




*Steam and Steam Generator*

2.1

Introduction to steam formation and its types

2.2

Introduction to steam table

2.4

Boiler definition and its classification

2.5

Cochran boiler, Babcock and Wilcox boiler and its mountings and
accessories *(Lab
Exp. 1 & 2)*

2.6

Efficiencies of boiler

*7.                  Scope of Civil Engineering*
7.1               Scope of Civil engineering
7.2               Branches of civil engineering,
7.3                Role of civil engineer

*8.                 Introduction to Surveying*
8.1               Definition of surveying
8.2              Objects of surveying, uses of surveying
8.3              Primary divisions of surveying, principles of surveying
-- 

Best Regards,



Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar (M.Tech.| PhD)

Assistant Professor

Charotar University of Science & Technology

+91 90992 23998 | abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in

subject: INFO_STUDENT NOTICE
snippet: Dear Student of â€â€CHARUSAT University, This is an exclusive opportunity to elevate your skills and jumpstart your career with the LaunchED 2-Month Training + Internship Program, in collaboration with
content:
Dear Student of  â€â€*CHARUSAT University*,

This is an exclusive opportunity to elevate your skills and jumpstart your
career with the LaunchED 2-Month Training + Internship Program, in
collaboration with Wipro Dice ID AICTE Certification.
ğŸš€  *Application Deadline: 12:00 PM [23-02-2025]*
------------------------------

*ğŸ“‹ Application Form : *  https://forms.gle/dGvdjim8GEmwHrSD8
*âœ…Referral ID:*â€*CHARUSAT**_DICE ID  (FOR*â€ *CHARUSAT* *STUDENTS ONLY)*
------------------------------

*What Youâ€™ll Gain:*

   1.

   *Comprehensive Training & Mentorship*
   - *Month 1*: Interactive, live sessions with industry leaders through
      your personalized learning portal.
      - *Month 2*: Real-world internship projects, providing you with the
      guidance of industry experts.
   2.

   *Industry-Recognized Certifications*
   - *Course Completion Certificate* from Lanched Global .
      - *Internship Certificate* from top MNCs, verified by Wipro DICE ID.
   3.

   *Professional Skill Development*
   - Master cutting-edge technologies such as *Generative AI*, *Prompt
      Engineering*, and *Low/No-Code Applications*.
      - Attend exclusive guest lectures from leaders at *Microsoft* and
      *Meta*.
   4.

   *Exclusive Benefits*
   - *6-month access* to a comprehensive LMS portal with personalized
      learning options.
      - *Placement Assistance* through a dedicated growth community.
      - *24/7 personalized mentorship* and live doubt-clearing sessions to
      ensure you are on track.

This program is designed to provide you with an invaluable opportunity to
gain practical knowledge and industry credentials that will set you apart
in todayâ€™s competitive job market.
*Why You Should Apply Now:*

   - Gain unparalleled mentorship and guidance from top industry leaders.
   - Improve your employability with certifications that are globally
   recognized.
   - Access exclusive internship opportunities that can lead to exciting
   career prospects.

* Apply before the deadline to secure your place.*

For students who are already enrolled, please disregard this message.

Best regards,
*LaunchED Global*

subject: Seating Arrangement - B.Tech-II : Midterm Exam Starting from 10th March, 2025
snippet: Dear Students, You are requested to adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in the email attachment. Also, you have to uphold decorum in the examination hall. Mobile phones, smartwatches, or any
content:
Dear Students,

You are requested to adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in the
email attachment. Also, you have to uphold decorum in the examination hall.
Mobile phones, smartwatches, or any other electronic devices are strictly
prohibited within the exam hall. Bags must be left outside, and it is
mandatory to wear an ID card. Students have to take their seat in
the exam hall at least 15 minutes prior to the exam time. At 10:15 AM the
entry gate will be closed, and after 10:20 AM no one will be allowed to
enter the examination hall.

The exam will take place in Exam Hall 201 (first floor) and 301 (second
floor) of the Multi Utility Complex.

Thank you.

-- 
Dr. Nilaykumar A. Patel
Associate professor & Head,
Electrical Engineering Dept.
Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT,
Changa. 388421, Ta: Petlad.
Phone:02697 265041

 at *Charusat University* on *February 28th* â€“ a must-attend event for

snippet: Notification settings 24ME-EE-CL New assignment Week-2 Write a Python program to print 1 to 20 numbers using the for and while loop. Write a Python program to sum 1 to 20 numbers using a for and while
content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s&Email=24ee001@charusat.edu.in>
24ME-EE-CL  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzM3NDE4ODMwODEw&Email=24ee001@charusat.edu.in>
New assignment

Week-2

    - Write a Python program to print 1 to 20 numbers using the for and  
while loop.
    - Write a Python program to sum 1 to 20 numbers using a for and while  
loop.
    - Write a Python program to find the factorial of 10 using for and while.
    - Print the multiplication table of a number (e.g., 5x1=5 to 5x10=50).
    - Use a while loop to calculate the sum of digits of a number.
    - Write a Python program to find the gretest number among the given five  
numbers.
    - Write a Python program to reverse the given number.

Instructions

    - Write your ID number, aim, actual code, and output in an ipynb file as  
discussed in the lab session.
    - To download an ipynb file in Google Colab, go to the file menu and  
download the ipynb file.
    - file name must be your ID number.
    - Feel free to contact me for any queries.
    - For every program, the first line will be the print function, which  
will print your ID number.

Due Feb 28
See details  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzM3NDE4ODMwODEw/a/NzM4MTkzNTM4MTk5/details&Email=24ee001@charusat.edu.in>

subject: LaunchED KSHITIJ IIT KHARAGPUR CERTIFICATIONS FOR CHARUSAT STUDENTS
snippet: Dear Students Warm greetings From LaunchED Kshitij 2025 (IIT), Kharagpur We are thrilled to share an exceptional opportunity tailored for the creative minds of Batch 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024. In
content:
*Dear Students*

Warm greetings From *LaunchED *Kshitij 2025 (IIT), Kharagpur

We are thrilled to share an exceptional opportunity tailored for the
creative minds of *Batch 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024*. In collaboration with
*LaunchED * Kshitij 2025 (IIT), Kharagpur we present a *two-month Training
and Internship Program* featuring certifications from global leaders, and
other renowned organizations.

*Who Can Apply?*

We invite applications from shortlisted students across all departments. If
any of your classmates have not received this information, please forward
this email to them.


Submit your Application <https://forms.gle/ZsNx4HhQH9v2QHkv7>

*Program Highlights*

   -

   *Month 1: Training*
   - Live industry-led sessions and recorded materials.
   -

   *Month 2: Internship*
   - Hands-on individual projects and a group capstone project with
      professional mentorship.

*Key Benefits*

   -
   - *Certificate of Completion* from  *LaunchED * Kshitij 2025 (IIT),
   Kharagpur
   - *Verified certification* via Wipro Dice ID.
   - *Co-branded Internship Certificate* from leading MNCs.
   - *100% Placement Assistance* and access to an expanding professional
   network.
   - Training on *Low-Code and No-Code Tools* and *Generative AI* concepts.
   - Invitations to *Exclusive Masterclasses* hosted by industry leaders.
   - *Personalized mentorship* for tailored career development.

content:
Dear Students,
Please find the reference book and assignments attached to this email.
Also, complete the assignments once the topic has been covered in class.
You will be required to submit the assignments periodically as directed by
the respective faculty members. The marking pattern of the assignment is
explained in the trailing mail.
Thanks & Regards
MSM

From: mihir mehta <mihirmehta.ee@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Dec 27, 2024 at 11:29â€¯AM
Subject: EEUC101 : BEEE Course Material
To: ee <ee@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Faculty Members,
Kindly share the following material with the students of your class.

I've shared the Lab Manual with the Xerox Center, ask the students to
collect the spiral binding from the same.
Lab Manual needs to be assessed on a regular basis
for continuous evaluation.

*Attached are assignments that will be examined by the CLASS instructors.*

Each assignment needs to be marked out of 10.

An example of the marking scheme is shown in the following table below
Assignment Marks
Assignment - 1 Assignment - 2 Assignment - 3 Assignment - 4 Assignment
- 5 Assignment
- 6 Assignment - 7 Assignment - 8 Total Avg = Total/8 Rounding
10 7 5 8 9 10 7 10 66 8.25 8

Feel free to contact for any queries/confusion.

Thanks & Regards
MSM
